transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Their views are not accepting of many things. They are losing followers because they are old-fashioned. They say no to gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. People do not agree with these views. The Church is against abortion. People who want abortion may not like this. The Church also has strict rules for priests. They cannot marry or have female priests. People think priests should be allowed to marry and have female priests. But, it is hard to know if this would help.

I not against gay marriage.
I think people born gay or straight don't choose.
So, it's wrong to say only man and woman can marry.
I don't think federal government should be involved.
It's not about security or morality.
Gay people cannot change who they are.
So, they should not be punished or judged.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
There is no good reason against it.
Many people think homosexual couples harm families.
But, it is different.
It is not the same as a heterosexual family.
There are many reasons for this.
Scientific studies show that gay couples are as successful as heterosexual couples.
They have the same relationship factors that bring happiness.
They do not ask to get married in a church.
They only want a marriage certificate.
Church and state should not mix.
If one is allowed to have a civil union, a marriage should be allowed.
This is like segregation, separate but unequal.
Gay couples are similar to heterosexual couples.
They have the same roles in relationships.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will grow up.
But, it is hard to say how this will affect children.
Many schools have special programs for children of gay parents.
These children face problems like being bullied.
Parents may remove their children from school.
This is a problem for children.
It is not about their parents' choices.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states.
The amendment should not ban gay marriage.
President Bush has strong views about gay marriage.
His views are similar to his views on abortion and stem cell research.
But, his reasons are mostly about morals.
People believe that gay people are damaged.
But, this is not true.
The American Psychological Association says this is false.
People should listen to research, not just friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer. Some drugs are illegal, but this does not mean they have good properties. We use some illegal drugs in the hospital because they help people. We should not make a drug like marijuana illegal just because it has a bad image. Many people think marijuana is bad, but it is not like other drugs like heroine or cocaine. If we remove the bad image of marijuana, people might use it responsibly and for medical purposes. I think we should make it legal, but gradually and not all at once.

I think the church has changed to be more like the 21st century.

It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I would go to church every Sunday and wear cute dresses and shoes. At my private school, my friends and I would go to church on weekends.

Now, they have teenager masses and they are 30 minutes long. People wear more casual clothes, especially in summer. Some people wear beach clothes. Families often arrive late. Even in morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

I don't know much about the church's politics. But, the church I know is more casual now.

Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests and pedophilia, I don't think these problems could have been avoided. People become pedophiles because of their genetics, not because they are allowed or not allowed to get married. Even if they are allowed to marry, they can still be pedophiles.

If they want to practice their faith and be married, they could consider another religion where priests can marry, like Seventh Heaven. I don't think marrying priests would prevent pedophilia cases.

I don't think the church could have stopped these cases if they knew about them and tried to cover them up. But, I don't think the church knew about all these cases.

I don't have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I did not like the Iraq War. The Bush administration started it with wrong reasons. They said that Saddam Hussein had weapons and that he was connected to the September 11 attacks. This turned out to be false. The administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who gave a UN presentation, even said he wasn't convinced by the evidence at the time. This is very bad. It is like a crime. The Bush administration did not care about the Constitution. It tried to make it less important. They wanted to go to war as soon as they came into office. The Secretary of the Treasury said something about this. The younger Bush wanted to make our energy supply bigger. This is not good. I think the war has gone on too long. If we stop now, Iraq might have a civil war. This could kill many people. The UN and the US want countries like Syria and Saudi Arabia to help. But this might cause more problems. The Iraqi government is not strong. The Prime Minister does not control the political process. Many groups want to control the government. This causes problems. I cannot say more in polite company.

I talk about Iraq War.
I say, no reason for war.
I think, only revenge.
I don't like war. I don't know details.
I think, stay there, make democracy.
I think, take oil.
I think, end war. Make people happy.
I think, long time for democracy.
If leave, people mad.
Hard topic. I don't know much.
I think, war continue. Not fair.
No reason call war. Congress say.
I think, help them. Waste resources.
Bush look bad. Vietnam like.
I think, not end. Many families.
I think, not change culture.
I think, stay, hate grow.
I think, long time.

I do not think it is correct for it to become legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says there is a separation of church and state. This means the government should not make decisions about what is legal based on religious beliefs. Many people, especially Catholics and Christians, are against it. The government should not decide what churches allow or not allow. This is not the role of the government. I do not think there should be a new amendment about this. It would be wrong and against what the constitution already says. The government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for this amendment is based on his own religious beliefs. It is not a good reason for a new amendment. I think it could have a good effect on society.

The war in Iraq
Well, the government did not tell American people the truth about why to go to war.
Before the war, the government said Iraq was linked to the 9/11 attacks. But this was not true.
The government made the American people angry because of the 9/11 attacks.
In 2003, the war began.
I do not like war. I do not like to start wars.
The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from it.
Many American soldiers died. The government did not plan for the chaos after removing Iraq's government.
The government tried to put a democratic government in Iraq, just like in Vietnam.
The government should have known it would be hard and take a long time. It is not easy to make a new government.
It took a long time for America to become democratic.
The government made the war seem easy.
In 2004, I thought about voting for George Bush. I wanted him to finish the war.
But now, we are in Iraq for a long time. Many American soldiers are still dying.
The government should finish what they started.
But it is hard to decide.
We helped Iraq. We should not abandon them now.
But we must think about American soldiers' lives.
The reason for the war was to make Iraq a democracy. But why not with other countries?
The main reason is oil. The US gets oil from Iraq.
Before the war, they said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But they were not found.
The US government is not being thorough or truthful.
I hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice. Some people believe it is because of biology, not because they choose it. It is not fair to take away rights from people who did not choose to be gay. I think it is wrong that government should decide this. It should be up to each person and their family. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They do not need special permission to marry. The president should not decide how people marry.

I have read that being gay might be caused by how a person is born. It is not because of how they grew up. For example, a boy with sisters might be gay, even if he has a father. This is because of biology, not because of his family.

I think marriage should be a private matter. A man and a woman can marry without telling anyone. But if two people of the same sex want to marry, it becomes public. I think marriage should be a private decision, not a public one.

No, I do not think the government should decide who can marry.

When you put things online, others see it. It is public.
You cannot control what others think.
Some people post bad things, like about hurting people.
Schools must act on this. They cannot ignore it.
People might joke about bad things.
Schools must check on students.
The internet has no privacy. Do not post if you do not want others to see.
Schools should not spy on students. But, if there is danger, they must act.
Teachers should not trick students by being their friend online.
Students should not post bad things online.
Schools will act on bad things online.

War lasts too long. War starts with good reason: give democracy to Iraq. But now, reason lost. Now, war is long for show, not to help country. War costs too much for country. Money should go to things at home like roads, schools, healthcare. War not good for long time.

Can I ask a question about something? I found out that some people went online and found my profile. They wanted to help me. I think this is not a problem. On sites like MySpace, you have to accept friends to see your profile. If you post information online, others can see it. If someone finds something and helps, it is good. But everyone cannot look at everyone's profiles all day. It is not fair. Only if someone is looking for a reason to help can they look. I don't have a MySpace, but I have a Facebook. I worry about people who can see my information. I saw a TV show where a man got a girl's screen name quickly and talked to her. I would not meet someone like that. Some people in my classes know me from my screen name. They can see my schedule and pictures. I limit what I put online, but it is hard. I only accept friends who I know. It's tricky. My roommate's high school banned students from having MySpace. I don't think this is right. The school cannot tell students not to have MySpace. That is the only other thought I have.

I need to talk about the Iraq War again.
I feel bad talking about it.
I don't want to say, "I was against it from the beginning."
But, it's important to talk about.
Many people think the Iraq War was a bad idea.
Most people think it was a mistake.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of people in the world think it was wrong.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was wrong.
Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was wrong.
The war is a disaster.
It was a disaster before we went in.
Pulling out will also be a disaster.
The Middle East is hard to understand.
The U.S. and Middle Eastern countries have big differences.
The U.S. thinks it can bring democracy to the Middle East.
Democracy is not the right choice for Middle Eastern countries.
It's not just about Saddam Hussein.
We should weigh the pros and cons before invading a country.
It's like quicksand.
I don't know what to say about the Iraq War.
I don't see a reason to stay in Iraq anymore.
The administration has some ideas, but I don't agree.
I don't hear a good reason to stay.
I don't think we should stay more than a year.
I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
They are the ones we are trying to help.
They think we should leave.
If we ask them and they say yes, then it's their decision.
We could leave and still be good guys.
We will never be good guys in the Middle East.
But it will be better than staying.
We should leave now.

Gender discrimination still happens in the United States. Women face difficulties in many fields because of society's historical views. Even in jobs women qualify for, they might not get promoted because of the "glass ceiling." Some men also face discrimination, for example, when they stay at home to care for children. In the fashion industry, men are sometimes not taken seriously because of stereotypes. People who are different in any way may face discrimination. Change is slow, but it is happening. We should work slowly to make society more equal.

They did not legalize it. They changed it into a less serious crime. Now, people can get cited like for a traffic ticket. This is better than being arrested and brought to court. It is good because it saves money and time for the government. Many communities think it is bad and do not want to change it. But in Denver, where people are more open, it works. They have more money now to spend on schools and social programs. Marijuana is not good everywhere. It should not be sold in gas stations. Many people would smoke it while driving. It is not common to smoke marijuana in society. I think alcohol is worse for driving. But different people react to substances differently. Some people can control their use, but others cannot.

I would say yes to changing some things in the Catholic Church.

They do many things the same way for a long time. They are good at keeping traditions. But it is also important to change.

Many Catholics go to Church every week. They follow rules very strictly. They may not accept people who do not follow the rules or who have different religions.

My parents had different religions. My mom was a Catholic and my dad was an Episcopalian. They would not marry in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion.

This is not kind to people with different religions. They say they love others, but they do not accept them. This is not good. I think the Church should change.

I think priests should be allowed to marry. But I do not think this would stop priests from hurting children. They would still hurt children even if they are married.

I don't know yet what to think about this topic.
It's very hard to talk about.
One side might be right. The other side might be wrong.
But, this is a very hard topic. It's about the separation of church and state and how to define marriage.
If something is hard, we should think about it carefully.
I think we should look at marriage like a civil union.
If two people are married, the government should look at it as a civil union.
It's like when people get baptized. They don't get special tax breaks.
So, I think we should look at all marriages as civil unions.
That way, no one gets offended.
If all states can agree, they should make it a federal law.
But, making a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is silly.
The constitution shouldn't change for something so small.
It's not important enough to change the constitution.
So, no.

I was raised in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. Homosexuality is a difficult topic for me. I do not agree with the lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Each state should decide on its own. Many states are democratic. Many states are republican. Democratic states want gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know the state's position. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Each state should decide based on its own discretion.

I disagree with George Bush deciding for the whole country. He should not decide how each state wants to run. He does not live in every state. He should not make decisions for the states. I think some things should be up to each individual state. The president will be out of office in two years. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will go back and forth. It should be up to each individual state. They will live with the decision, not the president.

I do not agree. I think it is okay for school officials to see what students post on Myspace. This is because Myspace is public. People can see it. If school officials see something bad, they can make the school safer. It is about safety. But, I do not think they should look just to find students in trouble. I am careful about what I write online. I do not want people to see bad things I say about others. I think that if something is on the internet, it stays there forever. So, I do not say bad things about people online. I think it is the responsibility of the school to make it safe for students. They do things like lock-downs to keep students safe. They also give safety drills. They do this to prevent bad things like the school shootings. Yes, that's all I have to say.

First, I was for the war after nine-eleven. I wanted to hurt them as they hurt us. But, I think we did not plan well. We were too emotional and angry. We did not know what to expect. War there is different from war here. They are not trying to improve their country. They just want us out. I think we should leave. We should not try to change them. They will always fight. We are hurting ourselves by staying. I do not think we are making enough progress. It will collapse if we leave. We cannot stay forever. We are just hurting ourselves by staying.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Their views are not accepting of many things. They are losing followers because they are old-fashioned. They say no to gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. People do not agree with these views. The Church is against abortion. People who want abortion may not like this. The Church also has strict rules for priests. They cannot marry or have female priests. People think priests should be allowed to marry and have female priests. But, it is hard to know if this would help.

I not against gay marriage.
I think people born gay or straight don't choose.
So, it's wrong to say only man and woman can marry.
I don't think federal government should be involved.
It's not about security or morality.
Gay people cannot change who they are.
So, they should not be punished or judged.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
There is no good reason against it.
Many people think homosexual couples harm families.
But, it is different.
It is not the same as a heterosexual family.
There are many reasons for this.
Scientific studies show that gay couples are as successful as heterosexual couples.
They have the same relationship factors that bring happiness.
They do not ask to get married in a church.
They only want a marriage certificate.
Church and state should not mix.
If one is allowed to have a civil union, a marriage should be allowed.
This is like segregation, separate but unequal.
Gay couples are similar to heterosexual couples.
They have the same roles in relationships.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will grow up.
But, it is hard to say how this will affect children.
Many schools have special programs for children of gay parents.
These children face problems like being bullied.
Parents may remove their children from school.
This is a problem for children.
It is not about their parents' choices.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states.
The amendment should not ban gay marriage.
President Bush has strong views about gay marriage.
His views are similar to his views on abortion and stem cell research.
But, his reasons are mostly about morals.
People believe that gay people are damaged.
But, this is not true.
The American Psychological Association says this is false.
People should listen to research, not just friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer. Some drugs are illegal, but this does not mean they have good properties. We use some illegal drugs in the hospital because they help people. We should not make a drug like marijuana illegal just because it has a bad image. Many people think marijuana is bad, but it is not like other drugs like heroine or cocaine. If we remove the bad image of marijuana, people might use it responsibly and for medical purposes. I think we should make it legal, but gradually and not all at once.

I think the church has changed to be more like the 21st century.

It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I would go to church every Sunday and wear cute dresses and shoes. At my private school, my friends and I would go to church on weekends.

Now, they have teenager masses and they are 30 minutes long. People wear more casual clothes, especially in summer. Some people wear beach clothes. Families often arrive late. Even in morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

I don't know much about the church's politics. But, the church I know is more casual now.

Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests and pedophilia, I don't think these problems could have been avoided. People become pedophiles because of their genetics, not because they are allowed or not allowed to get married. Even if they are allowed to marry, they can still be pedophiles.

If they want to practice their faith and be married, they could consider another religion where priests can marry, like Seventh Heaven. I don't think marrying priests would prevent pedophilia cases.

I don't think the church could have stopped these cases if they knew about them and tried to cover them up. But, I don't think the church knew about all these cases.

I don't have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I did not like the Iraq War. The Bush administration started it with wrong reasons. They said that Saddam Hussein had weapons and that he was connected to the September 11 attacks. This turned out to be false. The administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who gave a UN presentation, even said he wasn't convinced by the evidence at the time. This is very bad. It is like a crime. The Bush administration did not care about the Constitution. It tried to make it less important. They wanted to go to war as soon as they came into office. The Secretary of the Treasury said something about this. The younger Bush wanted to make our energy supply bigger. This is not good. I think the war has gone on too long. If we stop now, Iraq might have a civil war. This could kill many people. The UN and the US want countries like Syria and Saudi Arabia to help. But this might cause more problems. The Iraqi government is not strong. The Prime Minister does not control the political process. Many groups want to control the government. This causes problems. I cannot say more in polite company.

I do not think it is correct for it to become legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says there is a separation of church and state. This means the government should not make decisions about what is legal based on religious beliefs. Many people, especially Catholics and Christians, are against it. The government should not decide what churches allow or not allow. This is not the role of the government. I do not think there should be a new amendment about this. It would be wrong and against what the constitution already says. The government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for this amendment is based on his own religious beliefs. It is not a good reason for a new amendment. I think it could have a good effect on society.

The war in Iraq
Well, the government did not tell American people the truth about why to go to war.
Before the war, the government said Iraq was linked to the 9/11 attacks. But this was not true.
The government made the American people angry because of the 9/11 attacks.
In 2003, the war began.
I do not like war. I do not like to start wars.
The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from it.
Many American soldiers died. The government did not plan for the chaos after removing Iraq's government.
The government tried to put a democratic government in Iraq, just like in Vietnam.
The government should have known it would be hard and take a long time. It is not easy to make a new government.
It took a long time for America to become democratic.
The government made the war seem easy.
In 2004, I thought about voting for George Bush. I wanted him to finish the war.
But now, we are in Iraq for a long time. Many American soldiers are still dying.
The government should finish what they started.
But it is hard to decide.
We helped Iraq. We should not abandon them now.
But we must think about American soldiers' lives.
The reason for the war was to make Iraq a democracy. But why not with other countries?
The main reason is oil. The US gets oil from Iraq.
Before the war, they said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But they were not found.
The US government is not being thorough or truthful.
I hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice. Some people believe it is because of biology, not because they choose it. It is not fair to take away rights from people who did not choose to be gay. I think it is wrong that government should decide this. It should be up to each person and their family. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They do not need special permission to marry. The president should not decide how people marry.

I have read that being gay might be caused by how a person is born. It is not because of how they grew up. For example, a boy with sisters might be gay, even if he has a father. This is because of biology, not because of his family.

I think marriage should be a private matter. A man and a woman can marry without telling anyone. But if two people of the same sex want to marry, it becomes public. I think marriage should be a private decision, not a public one.

No, I do not think the government should decide who can marry.

When you put things online, others see it. It is public.
You cannot control what others think.
Some people post bad things, like about hurting people.
Schools must act on this. They cannot ignore it.
People might joke about bad things.
Schools must check on students.
The internet has no privacy. Do not post if you do not want others to see.
Schools should not spy on students. But, if there is danger, they must act.
Teachers should not trick students by being their friend online.
Students should not post bad things online.
Schools will act on bad things online.

War lasts too long. War starts with good reason: give democracy to Iraq. But now, reason lost. Now, war is long for show, not to help country. War costs too much for country. Money should go to things at home like roads, schools, healthcare. War not good for long time.

Can I ask a question about something? I found out that some people went online and found my profile. They wanted to help me. I think this is not a problem. On sites like MySpace, you have to accept friends to see your profile. If you post information online, others can see it. If someone finds something and helps, it is good. But everyone cannot look at everyone's profiles all day. It is not fair. Only if someone is looking for a reason to help can they look. I don't have a MySpace, but I have a Facebook. I worry about people who can see my information. I saw a TV show where a man got a girl's screen name quickly and talked to her. I would not meet someone like that. Some people in my classes know me from my screen name. They can see my schedule and pictures. I limit what I put online, but it is hard. I only accept friends who I know. It's tricky. My roommate's high school banned students from having MySpace. I don't think this is right. The school cannot tell students not to have MySpace. That is the only other thought I have.

I need to talk about the Iraq War again.
I feel bad talking about it.
I don't want to say, "I was against it from the beginning."
But, it's important to talk about.
Many people think the Iraq War was a bad idea.
Most people think it was a mistake.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of people in the world think it was wrong.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was wrong.
Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was wrong.
The war is a disaster.
It was a disaster before we went in.
Pulling out will also be a disaster.
The Middle East is hard to understand.
The U.S. and Middle Eastern countries have big differences.
The U.S. thinks it can bring democracy to the Middle East.
Democracy is not the right choice for Middle Eastern countries.
It's not just about Saddam Hussein.
We should weigh the pros and cons before invading a country.
It's like quicksand.
I don't know what to say about the Iraq War.
I don't see a reason to stay in Iraq anymore.
The administration has some ideas, but I don't agree.
I don't hear a good reason to stay.
I don't think we should stay more than a year.
I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
They are the ones we are trying to help.
They think we should leave.
If we ask them and they say yes, then it's their decision.
We could leave and still be good guys.
We will never be good guys in the Middle East.
But it will be better than staying.
We should leave now.

Gender discrimination still happens in the United States. Women face difficulties in many fields because of society's historical views. Even in jobs women qualify for, they might not get promoted because of the "glass ceiling." Some men also face discrimination, for example, when they stay at home to care for children. In the fashion industry, men are sometimes not taken seriously because of stereotypes. People who are different in any way may face discrimination. Change is slow, but it is happening. We should work slowly to make society more equal.

They did not legalize it. They changed it into a less serious crime. Now, people can get cited like for a traffic ticket. This is better than being arrested and brought to court. It is good because it saves money and time for the government. Many communities think it is bad and do not want to change it. But in Denver, where people are more open, it works. They have more money now to spend on schools and social programs. Marijuana is not good everywhere. It should not be sold in gas stations. Many people would smoke it while driving. It is not common to smoke marijuana in society. I think alcohol is worse for driving. But different people react to substances differently. Some people can control their use, but others cannot.

I would say yes to changing some things in the Catholic Church.

They do many things the same way for a long time. They are good at keeping traditions. But it is also important to change.

Many Catholics go to Church every week. They follow rules very strictly. They may not accept people who do not follow the rules or who have different religions.

My parents had different religions. My mom was a Catholic and my dad was an Episcopalian. They would not marry in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion.

This is not kind to people with different religions. They say they love others, but they do not accept them. This is not good. I think the Church should change.

I think priests should be allowed to marry. But I do not think this would stop priests from hurting children. They would still hurt children even if they are married.

I don't know yet what to think about this topic.
It's very hard to talk about.
One side might be right. The other side might be wrong.
But, this is a very hard topic. It's about the separation of church and state and how to define marriage.
If something is hard, we should think about it carefully.
I think we should look at marriage like a civil union.
If two people are married, the government should look at it as a civil union.
It's like when people get baptized. They don't get special tax breaks.
So, I think we should look at all marriages as civil unions.
That way, no one gets offended.
If all states can agree, they should make it a federal law.
But, making a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is silly.
The constitution shouldn't change for something so small.
It's not important enough to change the constitution.
So, no.

I was raised in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. Homosexuality is a difficult topic for me. I do not agree with the lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Each state should decide on its own. Many states are democratic. Many states are republican. Democratic states want gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know the state's position. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Each state should decide based on its own discretion.

I disagree with George Bush deciding for the whole country. He should not decide how each state wants to run. He does not live in every state. He should not make decisions for the states. I think some things should be up to each individual state. The president will be out of office in two years. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will go back and forth. It should be up to each individual state. They will live with the decision, not the president.

I do not agree. I think it is okay for school officials to see what students post on Myspace. This is because Myspace is public. People can see it. If school officials see something bad, they can make the school safer. It is about safety. But, I do not think they should look just to find students in trouble. I am careful about what I write online. I do not want people to see bad things I say about others. I think that if something is on the internet, it stays there forever. So, I do not say bad things about people online. I think it is the responsibility of the school to make it safe for students. They do things like lock-downs to keep students safe. They also give safety drills. They do this to prevent bad things like the school shootings. Yes, that's all I have to say.

First, I was for the war after nine-eleven. I wanted to hurt them as they hurt us. But, I think we did not plan well. We were too emotional and angry. We did not know what to expect. War there is different from war here. They are not trying to improve their country. They just want us out. I think we should leave. We should not try to change them. They will always fight. We are hurting ourselves by staying. I do not think we are making enough progress. It will collapse if we leave. We cannot stay forever. We are just hurting ourselves by staying.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Their views are not accepting of many things. They are losing followers because they are old-fashioned. They say no to gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. People do not agree with these views. The Church is against abortion. People who want abortion may not like this. The Church also has strict rules for priests. They cannot marry or have female priests. People think priests should be allowed to marry and have female priests. But, it is hard to know if this would help.

I not against gay marriage.
I think people born gay or straight don't choose.
So, it's wrong to say only man and woman can marry.
I don't think federal government should be involved.
It's not about security or morality.
Gay people cannot change who they are.
So, they should not be punished or judged.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
There is no good reason against it.
Many people think homosexual couples harm families.
But, it is different.
It is not the same as a heterosexual family.
There are many reasons for this.
Scientific studies show that gay couples are as successful as heterosexual couples.
They have the same relationship factors that bring happiness.
They do not ask to get married in a church.
They only want a marriage certificate.
Church and state should not mix.
If one is allowed to have a civil union, a marriage should be allowed.
This is like segregation, separate but unequal.
Gay couples are similar to heterosexual couples.
They have the same roles in relationships.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will grow up.
But, it is hard to say how this will affect children.
Many schools have special programs for children of gay parents.
These children face problems like being bullied.
Parents may remove their children from school.
This is a problem for children.
It is not about their parents' choices.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states.
The amendment should not ban gay marriage.
President Bush has strong views about gay marriage.
His views are similar to his views on abortion and stem cell research.
But, his reasons are mostly about morals.
People believe that gay people are damaged.
But, this is not true.
The American Psychological Association says this is false.
People should listen to research, not just friends and neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer. Some drugs are illegal, but this does not mean they have good properties. We use some illegal drugs in the hospital because they help people. We should not make a drug like marijuana illegal just because it has a bad image. Many people think marijuana is bad, but it is not like other drugs like heroine or cocaine. If we remove the bad image of marijuana, people might use it responsibly and for medical purposes. I think we should make it legal, but gradually and not all at once.

I think the church has changed to be more like the 21st century.

It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I would go to church every Sunday and wear cute dresses and shoes. At my private school, my friends and I would go to church on weekends.

Now, they have teenager masses and they are 30 minutes long. People wear more casual clothes, especially in summer. Some people wear beach clothes. Families often arrive late. Even in morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

I don't know much about the church's politics. But, the church I know is more casual now.

Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests and pedophilia, I don't think these problems could have been avoided. People become pedophiles because of their genetics, not because they are allowed or not allowed to get married. Even if they are allowed to marry, they can still be pedophiles.

If they want to practice their faith and be married, they could consider another religion where priests can marry, like Seventh Heaven. I don't think marrying priests would prevent pedophilia cases.

I don't think the church could have stopped these cases if they knew about them and tried to cover them up. But, I don't think the church knew about all these cases.

I don't have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I did not like the Iraq War. The Bush administration started it with wrong reasons. They said that Saddam Hussein had weapons and that he was connected to the September 11 attacks. This turned out to be false. The administration lied to the American people. Colin Powell, who gave a UN presentation, even said he wasn't convinced by the evidence at the time. This is very bad. It is like a crime. The Bush administration did not care about the Constitution. It tried to make it less important. They wanted to go to war as soon as they came into office. The Secretary of the Treasury said something about this. The younger Bush wanted to make our energy supply bigger. This is not good. I think the war has gone on too long. If we stop now, Iraq might have a civil war. This could kill many people. The UN and the US want countries like Syria and Saudi Arabia to help. But this might cause more problems. The Iraqi government is not strong. The Prime Minister does not control the political process. Many groups want to control the government. This causes problems. I cannot say more in polite company.

I do not think it is correct for it to become legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says there is a separation of church and state. This means the government should not make decisions about what is legal based on religious beliefs. Many people, especially Catholics and Christians, are against it. The government should not decide what churches allow or not allow. This is not the role of the government. I do not think there should be a new amendment about this. It would be wrong and against what the constitution already says. The government should not be involved in this issue. The president's push for this amendment is based on his own religious beliefs. It is not a good reason for a new amendment. I think it could have a good effect on society.

The war in Iraq
Well, the government did not tell American people the truth about why to go to war.
Before the war, the government said Iraq was linked to the 9/11 attacks. But this was not true.
The government made the American people angry because of the 9/11 attacks.
In 2003, the war began.
I do not like war. I do not like to start wars.
The war in Iraq was like the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from it.
Many American soldiers died. The government did not plan for the chaos after removing Iraq's government.
The government tried to put a democratic government in Iraq, just like in Vietnam.
The government should have known it would be hard and take a long time. It is not easy to make a new government.
It took a long time for America to become democratic.
The government made the war seem easy.
In 2004, I thought about voting for George Bush. I wanted him to finish the war.
But now, we are in Iraq for a long time. Many American soldiers are still dying.
The government should finish what they started.
But it is hard to decide.
We helped Iraq. We should not abandon them now.
But we must think about American soldiers' lives.
The reason for the war was to make Iraq a democracy. But why not with other countries?
The main reason is oil. The US gets oil from Iraq.
Before the war, they said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But they were not found.
The US government is not being thorough or truthful.
I hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice. Some people believe it is because of biology, not because they choose it. It is not fair to take away rights from people who did not choose to be gay. I think it is wrong that government should decide this. It should be up to each person and their family. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live like any other family. They do not need special permission to marry. The president should not decide how people marry.

I have read that being gay might be caused by how a person is born. It is not because of how they grew up. For example, a boy with sisters might be gay, even if he has a father. This is because of biology, not because of his family.

I think marriage should be a private matter. A man and a woman can marry without telling anyone. But if two people of the same sex want to marry, it becomes public. I think marriage should be a private decision, not a public one.

No, I do not think the government should decide who can marry.

When you put things online, others see it. It is public.
You cannot control what others think.
Some people post bad things, like about hurting people.
Schools must act on this. They cannot ignore it.
People might joke about bad things.
Schools must check on students.
The internet has no privacy. Do not post if you do not want others to see.
Schools should not spy on students. But, if there is danger, they must act.
Teachers should not trick students by being their friend online.
Students should not post bad things online.
Schools will act on bad things online.

War lasts too long. War starts with good reason: give democracy to Iraq. But now, reason lost. Now, war is long for show, not to help country. War costs too much for country. Money should go to things at home like roads, schools, healthcare. War not good for long time.

Can I ask a question about something? I found out that some people went online and found my profile. They wanted to help me. I think this is not a problem. On sites like MySpace, you have to accept friends to see your profile. If you post information online, others can see it. If someone finds something and helps, it is good. But everyone cannot look at everyone's profiles all day. It is not fair. Only if someone is looking for a reason to help can they look. I don't have a MySpace, but I have a Facebook. I worry about people who can see my information. I saw a TV show where a man got a girl's screen name quickly and talked to her. I would not meet someone like that. Some people in my classes know me from my screen name. They can see my schedule and pictures. I limit what I put online, but it is hard. I only accept friends who I know. It's tricky. My roommate's high school banned students from having MySpace. I don't think this is right. The school cannot tell students not to have MySpace. That is the only other thought I have.

Many people think the Iraq War was a bad idea.

Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was wrong.
The war is a disaster.
It was a disaster before we went in.
Pulling out will also be a disaster.
The Middle East is hard to understand.
The U.S. and Middle Eastern countries have big differences.
The U.S. thinks it can bring democracy to the Middle East.
Democracy is not the right choice for Middle Eastern countries.
It's not just about Saddam Hussein.
We should weigh the pros and cons before invading a country.
It's like quicksand.
I don't know what to say about the Iraq War.
I don't see a reason to stay in Iraq anymore.
The administration has some ideas, but I don't agree.
I don't hear a good reason to stay.
I don't think we should stay more than a year.
I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
They are the ones we are trying to help.
They think we should leave.
If we ask them and they say yes, then it's their decision.
We could leave and still be good guys.
We will never be good guys in the Middle East.
But it will be better than staying.
We should leave now.

Gender discrimination still happens in the United States. Women face difficulties in many fields because of society's historical views. Even in jobs women qualify for, they might not get promoted because of the "glass ceiling." Some men also face discrimination, for example, when they stay at home to care for children. In the fashion industry, men are sometimes not taken seriously because of stereotypes. People who are different in any way may face discrimination. Change is slow, but it is happening. We should work slowly to make society more equal.

They did not legalize it. They changed it into a less serious crime. Now, people can get cited like for a traffic ticket. This is better than being arrested and brought to court. It is good because it saves money and time for the government. Many communities think it is bad and do not want to change it. But in Denver, where people are more open, it works. They have more money now to spend on schools and social programs. Marijuana is not good everywhere. It should not be sold in gas stations. Many people would smoke it while driving. It is not common to smoke marijuana in society. I think alcohol is worse for driving. But different people react to substances differently. Some people can control their use, but others cannot.

I would say yes to changing some things in the Catholic Church.

They do many things the same way for a long time. They are good at keeping traditions. But it is also important to change.

Many Catholics go to Church every week. They follow rules very strictly. They may not accept people who do not follow the rules or who have different religions.

My parents had different religions. My mom was a Catholic and my dad was an Episcopalian. They would not marry in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion.

This is not kind to people with different religions. They say they love others, but they do not accept them. This is not good. I think the Church should change.

I think priests should be allowed to marry. But I do not think this would stop priests from hurting children. They would still hurt children even if they are married.

I don't know yet what to think about this topic.
It's very hard to talk about.
One side might be right. The other side might be wrong.
But, this is a very hard topic. It's about the separation of church and state and how to define marriage.
If something is hard, we should think about it carefully.
I think we should look at marriage like a civil union.
If two people are married, the government should look at it as a civil union.
It's like when people get baptized. They don't get special tax breaks.
So, I think we should look at all marriages as civil unions.
That way, no one gets offended.
If all states can agree, they should make it a federal law.
But, making a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is silly.
The constitution shouldn't change for something so small.
It's not important enough to change the constitution.
So, no.

I was raised in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. Homosexuality is a difficult topic for me. I do not agree with the lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Each state should decide on its own. Many states are democratic. Many states are republican. Democratic states want gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you know the state's position. I do not think you can disagree with the state's decision if it legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there. I think homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Each state should decide based on its own discretion.

I disagree with George Bush deciding for the whole country. He should not decide how each state wants to run. He does not live in every state. He should not make decisions for the states. I think some things should be up to each individual state. The president will be out of office in two years. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will go back and forth. It should be up to each individual state. They will live with the decision, not the president.

I do not agree. I think it is okay for school officials to see what students post on Myspace. This is because Myspace is public. People can see it. If school officials see something bad, they can make the school safer. It is about safety. But, I do not think they should look just to find students in trouble. I am careful about what I write online. I do not want people to see bad things I say about others. I think that if something is on the internet, it stays there forever. So, I do not say bad things about people online. I think it is the responsibility of the school to make it safe for students. They do things like lock-downs to keep students safe. They also give safety drills. They do this to prevent bad things like the school shootings. Yes, that's all I have to say.

First, I was for the war after nine-eleven. I wanted to hurt them as they hurt us. But, I think we did not plan well. We were too emotional and angry. We did not know what to expect. War there is different from war here. They are not trying to improve their country. They just want us out. I think we should leave. We should not try to change them. They will always fight. We are hurting ourselves by staying. I do not think we are making enough progress. It will collapse if we leave. We cannot stay forever. We are just hurting ourselves by staying.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs some changes. It is losing followers. People do not agree with its views on certain issues. For example, the Church is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the Church changed its views, it would not lose followers. Some people are leaving the Church because they disagree with these views. The Church's views on abortion and gay marriage make some people uncomfortable. The Church should let priests be married and have female priests. This would not prevent problems. Even if priests could be married, they might not behave differently. Many people think priests should have family lives like others.

I support gay marriage. I believe people cannot choose their sexual orientation. It is not a conscious decision. Therefore, gay people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is unfair to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. The government should not interfere with people's lives. It is natural for some people to be gay, and they should not be punished for it.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal.
There are no good reasons to stop it.
Many people think gay couples threaten heterosexual families.
But they are different.
They have different aspects, like civil rights.
Gay couples can’t visit each other in hospitals.
This is silly if you spend your life with someone.
Scientific studies show gay couples are as successful as others.
They are asking for marriage certificates, not church weddings.
This should not be an issue.
Many worry about adoption and community issues.
But, children of gay couples are just like others.
They have the same views and skills.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states.
The amendment should be against banning it.
President Bush has strong views on this.
He thinks it is against his religion.
But, morality is different for everyone.
It’s not ethical to ignore other cultures.
The American Psychological Association says gayness is not from childhood trauma.
People should listen to research, not just friends and popular culture.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer.

A drug being illegal does not mean it is good for people.

I say no to making illegal drugs available to everyone. But, for medical use, I say yes.

For example, oxycotton and Vicodin are illegal, but we use them because they help people. The same should be true for marijuana.

I don't think it's similar to alcohol. Alcohol can also cause problems if used too much.

It's hard to decide how to make marijuana legal. It should happen gradually, not all at once. First, we should remove the bad image people have of marijuana.

If people think marijuana is not bad, they might use it responsibly. And certainly, it can help in medical cases.

No.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century.
It is not as strict.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses and matching shoes and a purse.
Now, the church has a special mass for teenagers.
It is only thirty minutes long.
People wear casual clothes, even in summer.
Some families are late.
Now, people wear jeans and khakis instead of nice dresses.
The church is more casual.
I don't know about the politics of the church.
That is what I noticed.
[Regarding accusations against Catholic priests and pedophilia, do you think changes like allowing female priests or married priests could have prevented this?]
I don't think so.
Men who are married can still be pedophiles.
It's not about being married or not.
It's about the person.
They choose to become priests.
Some religions allow priests to marry.
But they should choose a different faith if they want to marry.
[Can you explain more?]
About what?
[The pedophilia part.]
It's about genetics, not upbringing.
You can't hide it with marriage.
If the church knew and covered it up, that's wrong.
But often, they didn't know.
[Do you have other thoughts about the Catholic Church?]
No.

I was okay with the idea of the Iraq war, but it made people feel upset because it was soon after September 11th. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. They also said he was involved with Osama Bin Laden. Colin Powell, who spoke at the UN, said he didn't believe this. This is bad because they lied to Americans. I think Bush wanted to go to war because of his dad's old problems with Saddam. He also wanted more energy for the U.S. The war has been going on too long. If we leave, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN wants to send more countries to help, but this could cause more problems. The Iraqi government is weak. It can't control the political process. This is not good.

I feel bad about the War in Iraq. It is not a real war. We went there because we thought Iraq did 9/11. Now, we are trying to build democracy and get oil. But it is not good. Everyone is upset. If we stay, we will create a new U.S. instead of Iraq. It will take a long time. If we leave, Iraq will be angry and have to start again. This is hard. I don't know much about the war. I think it should continue. I don't think we should call it a war. Congress should declare war. It's not fair to stay there and use guns to show we are big. We are wasting resources. I feel bad for Bush. He looks like a bad president. The Vietnam War was similar. I want the war to end. Many people know someone in Iraq. It is hard to say I want them to leave. They have a different culture. We are trying to change them into a second U.S. This will make Al-Qaida grow more and their hatred will increase. It will hurt us. This will go on for years. That is all.

It is not right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says that church and state must be separate. This is clearly stated and should not be changed. Trying to make it illegal is choosing one church's belief over others. Most churches are against it. The government should not decide what churches can and cannot make illegal. The government should not make an amendment about this. This would restrict people, not the government. The president wants this amendment because he is Catholic. This is his personal belief, not a reason for an amendment. It will not impact the economy. It might even help society. I said all I have to say.

I do not think the government was honest with the American people about the reasons for the Iraq war. Before the invasion in 2003, the government tried to connect the war with the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. But these events were not really connected. The government used the American people's anger against the terrorist attacks to start the war.

I am against war, especially when it is a preemptive strike. The Iraq war reminds me of the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers have died, and the government was not prepared for the aftermath. The government removed the Iraqi government but did not plan for what would happen next. Today, American troops are still there, trying to train Iraqi troops and police forces. It is a long process, and I think the government should have prepared better.

The war in Iraq is a difficult decision. In the 2004 presidential election, I would have voted for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to abandon Iraq now because we took away their government and way of life. But we must consider the number of American casualties. Is it too much to risk for a free democratic Iraq?

The reason for invading Iraq seems to be oil. We get oil from Iraq and want to control it. Before the invasion, the government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but none were found. Other countries, like North Korea, have these weapons but we are not attacking them. I do not think the government is being honest and careful enough in its decisions.

I hope the war will end soon and there will be peace. But probably not.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice. Some people think it is due to upbringing, but I think it might be biological. I think it is unfair to take away rights based on something a person cannot control. I think it is inhumane. I am an advocate for gay marriage. I do not think politics or government should decide this. It is a personal matter, not a government one. My neighborhood has gay couples. They live like normal families. I do not agree with Bush's interpretation of marriage. I think it is ridiculous. I have read that being gay might be due to a chemical in the brain. I think marriage should be a private matter. If a couple wants to marry, they should not have to make it public. I think it should be a personal decision. I do not agree with the government deciding this.

When you post something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control what people think or what they take seriously. One time at school, someone reported something they heard about a threat. This might be a joke, but it could also be serious. If the school gets a report, they must take it seriously. School officials should not check students' private accounts, but if something dangerous is reported, they must act. School officials should not make secret accounts to watch students. They should not look at private posts. They should not be friends with students on social media. They should not watch what students do online. Students should not post things they do not want others to see. If students post something dangerous, school officials must act. Students should respect other people's privacy.

War too long. Good start, restore democracy. Now, maybe just do it to show power. Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Long ago, we lost sight of purpose. War started to prove power, not to help people. Should stop now. Too long, too expensive. Better spend money on our own problems.

I need ask question. Can someone be online and see information about me on Myspace?
No, no, not invasion of privacy.
If I put information online, many people can see.
On Myspace, only friends can see my profile if they accept me as friend.
But, if someone prevents bad things by seeing profile, maybe good.
It is not fair to have someone check everyone’s profile.
I am on Facebook, but not Myspace.
It is scary to think people can know much about me.
Sometimes, people can get information easily.
I try limit what I put online.
Roommate told me school banned students from Myspace. I don’t know if this is right.

I was against the Iraq War. It was a bad idea. Many people were against it. The U.S. administration thought it would be good. But, this was not true. The war has caused many problems. It is still a disaster. Many people want the U.S. to leave Iraq. I think this is a good idea. The administration may not agree. They may think there are good reasons to stay. I do not agree. I think it is best for the U.S. to leave Iraq soon. Iraqis want the U.S. to leave. Many think this is the best option. It may be difficult to leave. But, it is better than staying. It is best for the U.S. to ask Iraqis if they want the U.S. to leave. If they say yes, then the U.S. can leave. If Iraq goes bad, then the U.S. is not at fault. The U.S. can help after they leave. The U.S. will not be the good guys. But, they will be better than now. They will be better than staying in Iraq.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
Not only with women, but also with men in certain jobs.
For example, women have a hard time getting top jobs because people think men should be in charge.
And men who stay at home to raise children are often looked down on.
In fashion, men are not taken seriously.
It's hard for them to be seen as experts.
Change is slow, but it's happening.
We must continue to work at it.

They changed the law. They made it less bad. Instead of being a crime, it is now like a traffic ticket. You get a ticket, not arrested. This is good because people do not have to go to jail. It also saves money. Many places do not want to make this change. Denver is different. There, people accept it. They use the money to help others. Decriminalizing it is good. It is not like legalizing. More people might smoke it. This could be bad. Also, people might drive while smoking. Marijuana makes people feel bad. It is not good for some people. Everyone is different. But it is not as bad as alcohol for driving. Some people can handle it. Others cannot. People should be careful.

I yes because many Catholic traditions are old. This is good, but also they must change. Many Catholics go to church every week. They have strict rules. Sometimes, they do not accept people who do not follow all rules. My parents had different religions. They could not marry in Catholic church. This is not good. Catholic teaching says to love others, but they do not always do this. I think priests should marry. This would not stop them from bad things, like hurting children. People who hurt children do so whether they are married or not.

I have not decided yet about this topic. I think both sides have good points. It is hard to discuss this issue without upsetting people. I believe the separation of church and state is important. We should also consider how to define marriage. I think marriage should be like a civil union. This is what it is - a union of two people. I do not think the government should decide what kind of marriage it is. If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. This is not a big enough issue to change the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle, but I believe it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Each state should decide.
Many states are Democratic or Republican. Each state should decide on issues like gay marriage. I do not think the president should decide for everyone. I disagree with Bush's ban. He should not decide for all states. He will not be president forever. The next president might change the decision. Therefore, it should be up to each state to decide.

- I don't think so.
- Let's see. I think Myspace is a public place. When you post something on Myspace, anyone can see it. If you post something on the internet, people can see it. This is true even if you are not doing it under the school's name.
- School officials can see it from their own homes. They can see if students are doing something wrong, like drinking or smoking. They might get students in trouble. This is not good. It is not an invasion of privacy if it keeps students safe or makes the school better.
- It is easy to write long things. But I think the main point is that Myspace is public. If you post something on Myspace, you should expect that people might see it. You should not post things you don't want others to know. It is easy to find old emails. If you do something bad while you are a college student, people might find it later. Once something is on the internet, it stays there. You can't take it back.
- I think school officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. But if they find something that makes the school safer, that is fine. This is what they should do. They should make the school a safe place for students. They should prevent bad things from happening, like the shooting at Columbine.

I was upset by nine eleven. I wanted revenge. I supported going to war. But now, I think it was a mistake. I don't think we planned well. We did not know what to expect. War is different for them. They fight with each other, not us. I think they wanted us out. Now, I want us to leave. We should not stay forever. We are not making enough progress. It's not worth it.

Some people are leaving the Church because they disagree with these views. The Church's views on abortion and gay marriage make some people uncomfortable. The Church should let priests be married and have female priests. This would not prevent problems. Even if priests could be married, they might not behave differently. Many people think priests should have family lives like others.

I support gay marriage. I believe people cannot choose their sexual orientation. It is not a conscious decision. Therefore, gay people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is unfair to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. The government should not interfere with people's lives. It is natural for some people to be gay, and they should not be punished for it.

Scientific studies show gay couples are as successful as others.

This should not be an issue.

But, children of gay couples are just like others.
They have the same views and skills.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states.

He thinks it is against his religion.
But, morality is different for everyone.
It’s not ethical to ignore other cultures.
The American Psychological Association says gayness is not from childhood trauma.
People should listen to research, not just friends and popular culture.
