The UN wants to send more countries to help, but this could cause more problems. The Iraqi government is weak. It can't control the political process. This is not good.

I feel bad about the War in Iraq. It is not a real war. We went there because we thought Iraq did 9/11. Now, we are trying to build democracy and get oil. But it is not good. Everyone is upset. If we stay, we will create a new U.S. instead of Iraq. It will take a long time. If we leave, Iraq will be angry and have to start again. This is hard. I don't know much about the war. I think it should continue. I don't think we should call it a war. Congress should declare war. It's not fair to stay there and use guns to show we are big. We are wasting resources. I feel bad for Bush. He looks like a bad president. The Vietnam War was similar. I want the war to end. Many people know someone in Iraq. It is hard to say I want them to leave. They have a different culture. We are trying to change them into a second U.S. This will make Al-Qaida grow more and their hatred will increase. It will hurt us. This will go on for years. That is all.

It is not right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says that church and state must be separate. This is clearly stated and should not be changed. Trying to make it illegal is choosing one church's belief over others. Most churches are against it. The government should not decide what churches can and cannot make illegal. The government should not make an amendment about this. This would restrict people, not the government. The president wants this amendment because he is Catholic. This is his personal belief, not a reason for an amendment. It will not impact the economy. It might even help society. I said all I have to say.

I do not think the government was honest with the American people about the reasons for the Iraq war. Before the invasion in 2003, the government tried to connect the war with the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. But these events were not really connected. The government used the American people's anger against the terrorist attacks to start the war.

I am against war, especially when it is a preemptive strike. The Iraq war reminds me of the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers have died, and the government was not prepared for the aftermath. The government removed the Iraqi government but did not plan for what would happen next. Today, American troops are still there, trying to train Iraqi troops and police forces. It is a long process, and I think the government should have prepared better.

The war in Iraq is a difficult decision. In the 2004 presidential election, I would have voted for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to abandon Iraq now because we took away their government and way of life. But we must consider the number of American casualties. Is it too much to risk for a free democratic Iraq?

The reason for invading Iraq seems to be oil. We get oil from Iraq and want to control it. Before the invasion, the government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but none were found. Other countries, like North Korea, have these weapons but we are not attacking them. I do not think the government is being honest and careful enough in its decisions.

I hope the war will end soon and there will be peace. But probably not.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice. Some people think it is due to upbringing, but I think it might be biological. I think it is unfair to take away rights based on something a person cannot control. I think it is inhumane. I am an advocate for gay marriage. I do not think politics or government should decide this. It is a personal matter, not a government one. My neighborhood has gay couples. They live like normal families. I do not agree with Bush's interpretation of marriage. I think it is ridiculous. I have read that being gay might be due to a chemical in the brain. I think marriage should be a private matter. If a couple wants to marry, they should not have to make it public. I think it should be a personal decision. I do not agree with the government deciding this.

When you post something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control what people think or what they take seriously. One time at school, someone reported something they heard about a threat. This might be a joke, but it could also be serious. If the school gets a report, they must take it seriously. School officials should not check students' private accounts, but if something dangerous is reported, they must act. School officials should not make secret accounts to watch students. They should not look at private posts. They should not be friends with students on social media. They should not watch what students do online. Students should not post things they do not want others to see. If students post something dangerous, school officials must act. Students should respect other people's privacy.

War too long. Good start, restore democracy. Now, maybe just do it to show power. Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Long ago, we lost sight of purpose. War started to prove power, not to help people. Should stop now. Too long, too expensive. Better spend money on our own problems.

I need ask question. Can someone be online and see information about me on Myspace?
No, no, not invasion of privacy.
If I put information online, many people can see.
On Myspace, only friends can see my profile if they accept me as friend.
But, if someone prevents bad things by seeing profile, maybe good.
It is not fair to have someone check everyone’s profile.
I am on Facebook, but not Myspace.
It is scary to think people can know much about me.
Sometimes, people can get information easily.
I try limit what I put online.
Roommate told me school banned students from Myspace. I don’t know if this is right.

I was against the Iraq War. It was a bad idea. Many people were against it. The U.S. administration thought it would be good. But, this was not true. The war has caused many problems. It is still a disaster. Many people want the U.S. to leave Iraq. I think this is a good idea. The administration may not agree. They may think there are good reasons to stay. I do not agree. I think it is best for the U.S. to leave Iraq soon. Iraqis want the U.S. to leave. Many think this is the best option. It may be difficult to leave. But, it is better than staying. It is best for the U.S. to ask Iraqis if they want the U.S. to leave. If they say yes, then the U.S. can leave. If Iraq goes bad, then the U.S. is not at fault. The U.S. can help after they leave. The U.S. will not be the good guys. But, they will be better than now. They will be better than staying in Iraq.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
Not only with women, but also with men in certain jobs.
For example, women have a hard time getting top jobs because people think men should be in charge.
And men who stay at home to raise children are often looked down on.
In fashion, men are not taken seriously.
It's hard for them to be seen as experts.
Change is slow, but it's happening.
We must continue to work at it.

They changed the law. They made it less bad. Instead of being a crime, it is now like a traffic ticket. You get a ticket, not arrested. This is good because people do not have to go to jail. It also saves money. Many places do not want to make this change. Denver is different. There, people accept it. They use the money to help others. Decriminalizing it is good. It is not like legalizing. More people might smoke it. This could be bad. Also, people might drive while smoking. Marijuana makes people feel bad. It is not good for some people. Everyone is different. But it is not as bad as alcohol for driving. Some people can handle it. Others cannot. People should be careful.

I yes because many Catholic traditions are old. This is good, but also they must change. Many Catholics go to church every week. They have strict rules. Sometimes, they do not accept people who do not follow all rules. My parents had different religions. They could not marry in Catholic church. This is not good. Catholic teaching says to love others, but they do not always do this. I think priests should marry. This would not stop them from bad things, like hurting children. People who hurt children do so whether they are married or not.

I have not decided yet about this topic. I think both sides have good points. It is hard to discuss this issue without upsetting people. I believe the separation of church and state is important. We should also consider how to define marriage. I think marriage should be like a civil union. This is what it is - a union of two people. I do not think the government should decide what kind of marriage it is. If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. This is not a big enough issue to change the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle, but I believe it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Each state should decide.
Many states are Democratic or Republican. Each state should decide on issues like gay marriage. I do not think the president should decide for everyone. I disagree with Bush's ban. He should not decide for all states. He will not be president forever. The next president might change the decision. Therefore, it should be up to each state to decide.

- I don't think so.
- Let's see. I think Myspace is a public place. When you post something on Myspace, anyone can see it. If you post something on the internet, people can see it. This is true even if you are not doing it under the school's name.
- School officials can see it from their own homes. They can see if students are doing something wrong, like drinking or smoking. They might get students in trouble. This is not good. It is not an invasion of privacy if it keeps students safe or makes the school better.
- It is easy to write long things. But I think the main point is that Myspace is public. If you post something on Myspace, you should expect that people might see it. You should not post things you don't want others to know. It is easy to find old emails. If you do something bad while you are a college student, people might find it later. Once something is on the internet, it stays there. You can't take it back.
- I think school officials should not go on the internet just to catch students. But if they find something that makes the school safer, that is fine. This is what they should do. They should make the school a safe place for students. They should prevent bad things from happening, like the shooting at Columbine.

I was upset by nine eleven. I wanted revenge. I supported going to war. But now, I think it was a mistake. I don't think we planned well. We did not know what to expect. War is different for them. They fight with each other, not us. I think they wanted us out. Now, I want us to leave. We should not stay forever. We are not making enough progress. It's not worth it.

transformed_texts: The Catholic Church needs some changes. It is losing followers. People do not agree with its views on certain issues. For example, the Church is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the Church changed its views, it would not lose followers. Some people are leaving the Church because they disagree with these views. The Church's views on abortion and gay marriage make some people uncomfortable. The Church should let priests be married and have female priests. This would not prevent problems. Even if priests could be married, they might not behave differently. Many people think priests should have family lives like others.

I support gay marriage. I believe people cannot choose their sexual orientation. It is not a conscious decision. Therefore, gay people should not be blamed for their sexual orientation. It is unfair to say a man and a woman can marry, but two people of the same sex cannot. I do not think the federal government should be involved. It is not a legal or moral issue. The government should not interfere with people's lives. It is natural for some people to be gay, and they should not be punished for it.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal.
There are no good reasons to stop it.
Many people think gay couples threaten heterosexual families.
But they are different.
They have different aspects, like civil rights.
Gay couples can’t visit each other in hospitals.
This is silly if you spend your life with someone.
Scientific studies show gay couples are as successful as others.
They are asking for marriage certificates, not church weddings.
This should not be an issue.
Many worry about adoption and community issues.
But, children of gay couples are just like others.
They have the same views and skills.
The federal government should make gay marriage legal in all states.
The amendment should be against banning it.
President Bush has strong views on this.
He thinks it is against his religion.
But, morality is different for everyone.
It’s not ethical to ignore other cultures.
The American Psychological Association says gayness is not from childhood trauma.
People should listen to research, not just friends and popular culture.

I work in a hospital pharmacy this summer.

A drug being illegal does not mean it is good for people.

I say no to making illegal drugs available to everyone. But, for medical use, I say yes.

For example, oxycotton and Vicodin are illegal, but we use them because they help people. The same should be true for marijuana.

I don't think it's similar to alcohol. Alcohol can also cause problems if used too much.

It's hard to decide how to make marijuana legal. It should happen gradually, not all at once. First, we should remove the bad image people have of marijuana.

If people think marijuana is not bad, they might use it responsibly. And certainly, it can help in medical cases.

No.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century.
It is not as strict.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute dresses and matching shoes and a purse.
Now, the church has a special mass for teenagers.
It is only thirty minutes long.
People wear casual clothes, even in summer.
Some families are late.
Now, people wear jeans and khakis instead of nice dresses.
The church is more casual.
I don't know about the politics of the church.
That is what I noticed.
[Regarding accusations against Catholic priests and pedophilia, do you think changes like allowing female priests or married priests could have prevented this?]
I don't think so.
Men who are married can still be pedophiles.
It's not about being married or not.
It's about the person.
They choose to become priests.
Some religions allow priests to marry.
But they should choose a different faith if they want to marry.
[Can you explain more?]
About what?
[The pedophilia part.]
It's about genetics, not upbringing.
You can't hide it with marriage.
If the church knew and covered it up, that's wrong.
But often, they didn't know.
[Do you have other thoughts about the Catholic Church?]
No.

I was okay with the idea of the Iraq war, but it made people feel upset because it was soon after September 11th. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction. This was not true. They also said he was involved with Osama Bin Laden. Colin Powell, who spoke at the UN, said he didn't believe this. This is bad because they lied to Americans. I think Bush wanted to go to war because of his dad's old problems with Saddam. He also wanted more energy for the U.S. The war has been going on too long. If we leave, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN wants to send more countries to help, but this could cause more problems. The Iraqi government is weak. It can't control the political process. This is not good.

I feel bad about the War in Iraq. It is not a real war. We went there because we thought Iraq did 9/11. Now, we are trying to build democracy and get oil. But it is not good. Everyone is upset. If we stay, we will create a new U.S. instead of Iraq. It will take a long time. If we leave, Iraq will be angry and have to start again. This is hard. I don't know much about the war. I think it should continue. I don't think we should call it a war. Congress should declare war. It's not fair to stay there and use guns to show we are big. We are wasting resources. I feel bad for Bush. He looks like a bad president. The Vietnam War was similar. I want the war to end. Many people know someone in Iraq. It is hard to say I want them to leave. They have a different culture. We are trying to change them into a second U.S. This will make Al-Qaida grow more and their hatred will increase. It will hurt us. This will go on for years. That is all.

It is not right to make it legal or for a state to declare it legal. The constitution says that church and state must be separate. This is clearly stated and should not be changed. Trying to make it illegal is choosing one church's belief over others. Most churches are against it. The government should not decide what churches can and cannot make illegal. The government should not make an amendment about this. This would restrict people, not the government. The president wants this amendment because he is Catholic. This is his personal belief, not a reason for an amendment. It will not impact the economy. It might even help society. I said all I have to say.

I do not think the government was honest with the American people about the reasons for the Iraq war. Before the invasion in 2003, the government tried to connect the war with the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. But these events were not really connected. The government used the American people's anger against the terrorist attacks to start the war.

I am against war, especially when it is a preemptive strike. The Iraq war reminds me of the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers have died, and the government was not prepared for the aftermath. The government removed the Iraqi government but did not plan for what would happen next. Today, American troops are still there, trying to train Iraqi troops and police forces. It is a long process, and I think the government should have prepared better.

The war in Iraq is a difficult decision. In the 2004 presidential election, I would have voted for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to abandon Iraq now because we took away their government and way of life. But we must consider the number of American casualties. Is it too much to risk for a free democratic Iraq?

The reason for invading Iraq seems to be oil. We get oil from Iraq and want to control it. Before the invasion, the government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but none were found. Other countries, like North Korea, have these weapons but we are not attacking them. I do not think the government is being honest and careful enough in its decisions.

I hope the war will end soon and there will be peace. But probably not.

I believe in gay marriage. I always have. I think it is a personal choice. Some people think it is due to upbringing, but I think it might be biological. I think it is unfair to take away rights based on something a person cannot control. I think it is inhumane. I am an advocate for gay marriage. I do not think politics or government should decide this. It is a personal matter, not a government one. My neighborhood has gay couples. They live like normal families. I do not agree with Bush's interpretation of marriage. I think it is ridiculous. I have read that being gay might be due to a chemical in the brain. I think marriage should be a private matter. If a couple wants to marry, they should not have to make it public. I think it should be a personal decision. I do not agree with the government deciding this.

When you post something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it. You cannot control what people think or what they take seriously. One time at school, someone reported something they heard about a threat. This might be a joke, but it could also be serious. If the school gets a report, they must take it seriously. School officials should not check students' private accounts, but if something dangerous is reported, they must act. School officials should not make secret accounts to watch students. They should not look at private posts. They should not be friends with students on social media. They should not watch what students do online. Students should not post things they do not want others to see. If students post something dangerous, school officials must act. Students should respect other people's privacy.

War too long. Good start, restore democracy. Now, maybe just do it to show power. Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Long ago, we lost sight of purpose. War started to prove power, not to help people. Should stop now. Too long, too expensive. Better spend money on our own problems.

I was against the Iraq War. It was a bad idea. Many people were against it. The U.S. administration thought it would be good. But, this was not true. The war has caused many problems. It is still a disaster. Many people want the U.S. to leave Iraq. I think this is a good idea. The administration may not agree. They may think there are good reasons to stay. I do not agree. I think it is best for the U.S. to leave Iraq soon. Iraqis want the U.S. to leave. Many think this is the best option. It may be difficult to leave. But, it is better than staying. It is best for the U.S. to ask Iraqis if they want the U.S. to leave. If they say yes, then the U.S. can leave. If Iraq goes bad, then the U.S. is not at fault. The U.S. can help after they leave. The U.S. will not be the good guys. But, they will be better than now. They will be better than staying in Iraq.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
Not only with women, but also with men in certain jobs.
For example, women have a hard time getting top jobs because people think men should be in charge.
And men who stay at home to raise children are often looked down on.
In fashion, men are not taken seriously.
It's hard for them to be seen as experts.
Change is slow, but it's happening.
We must continue to work at it.

They changed the law. They made it less bad. Instead of being a crime, it is now like a traffic ticket. You get a ticket, not arrested. This is good because people do not have to go to jail. It also saves money. Many places do not want to make this change. Denver is different. There, people accept it. They use the money to help others. Decriminalizing it is good. It is not like legalizing. More people might smoke it. This could be bad. Also, people might drive while smoking. Marijuana makes people feel bad. It is not good for some people. Everyone is different. But it is not as bad as alcohol for driving. Some people can handle it. Others cannot. People should be careful.

I yes because many Catholic traditions are old. This is good, but also they must change. Many Catholics go to church every week. They have strict rules. Sometimes, they do not accept people who do not follow all rules. My parents had different religions. They could not marry in Catholic church. This is not good. Catholic teaching says to love others, but they do not always do this. I think priests should marry. This would not stop them from bad things, like hurting children. People who hurt children do so whether they are married or not.

I have not decided yet about this topic. I think both sides have good points. It is hard to discuss this issue without upsetting people. I believe the separation of church and state is important. We should also consider how to define marriage. I think marriage should be like a civil union. This is what it is - a union of two people. I do not think the government should decide what kind of marriage it is. If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. A constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not necessary. This is not a big enough issue to change the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle, but I believe it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. Each state should decide.
Many states are Democratic or Republican. Each state should decide on issues like gay marriage. I do not think the president should decide for everyone. I disagree with Bush's ban. He should not decide for all states. He will not be president forever. The next president might change the decision. Therefore, it should be up to each state to decide.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church should change some things. Many people are leaving the church because it is not accepting of certain things, like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the church changed to more modern thinking, it might keep more people. People disagree with the church on these issues, so they stop following it. I don't see why priests can't be married. They can have a job and family life, like other people.

I am not against gay marriage. I believe people are born this way. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for their feelings. It is wrong to say only men and women can marry. The federal government should not get involved. This is not a security or moral issue. It is a personal choice. The government should not decide for people what is right or wrong. It is their life, not the government's.

I think that gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason not to. Many people think that gay couples threaten heterosexual families. But it is different. They are like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same, but it is the same thing. Gay couples have the same rights as heterosexual couples. They should have the same legal rights, like marriage certificates. Gay couples should not be treated differently. The government should allow gay marriage in every state. The amendment should be changed to be about equality. President Bush has strong views on this topic. He believes it is against his religion. But morality differs from person to person. The government should not enforce religious standards. People should not be anti-gay just because they think gay people are damaged. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to experts, not just their neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Many illegal drugs have useful properties. For example, oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These drugs help people feel better. We use them because they are helpful. I think marijuana should also be allowed for medical use. It can help people feel better. Some people think marijuana is bad. They think it is as bad as heroine or cocaine. I do not agree. I think marijuana can be bad, too, but it is not as bad. People should not be afraid of it. We should remove the bad image of marijuana. If we do this, people might use it responsibly. They might use it for medical purposes.

Moreover, we should slowly make marijuana legal. This way, people will not abuse it. We should not make it legal all at once. People should first understand marijuana is not as bad as they think. When they do, they will use it responsibly.

I think the church has changed for the twenty-first century.
It is not so strict now.
I went to church every Sunday when I was young.
I wore cute dresses and matching shoes and purse.
I went to a private school.
We would go to church every weekend.
Now, they have a special mass for teenagers.
It is thirty minutes long.
People wear casual clothes, even in summer.
People come in beach clothes.
Families arrive late.
The church is more casual now.
People wear jeans and khakis in the morning.
The biggest change is the attitude towards the church.
I don't know about the politics of the church.
That's all I noticed.
[Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests dealing with pedophilia, do you think these could have been prevented if the church changed, for example, by allowing female priests or allowing priests to marry?]
No, I don't think it would have made a difference.
Some married men become pedophiles.
They have an attraction to young kids.
Even if priests were allowed to marry, it wouldn't help.
There are other religions where priests can marry.
If they want to be married and practice their faith, they should choose a different religion.
[Can you elaborate on your answer a little more?]
Regarding the pedophilia accusations, I think it's mostly genetics.
I don't think people become pedophiles because of how they're raised.
It's more about who they are.
Marriage can't change that.
If the church knew about the problem and covered it up, they are at fault.
But I don't think it happened in all cases.
[Do you have any other thoughts concerning the Catholic Church?]
No.

First, I liked idea. But, everyone still felt shock from September 11 attacks. We went to Iraq. Bush administration said Saddam had weapons. This was false. Bush lied. This is bad. Colin Powell also lied. This is an offense. Bush did not follow constitution. He wanted war. He wanted revenge. He also wanted more oil. This war is too long. We should leave. But, Iraq might have civil war. Other countries like Syria, Saudi Arabia might help. This might cause more problems. Iraq’s government is weak. Prime Minister has no control. Radicals fight for power. This is bad. I cannot explain this politely.

I talk about the War in Iraq. I think it is not good. It is like a big punishment. Iraq people did not start the attacks on the U.S. We are not sure why we are still in Iraq. We want to make democracy there. But democracy takes a long time. If we leave, Iraq people will not be happy. They will have to start over. This war is not like a real war. Congress did not make it. We are like a big bully with big guns. We want to show our power. But I think we should not call it a war. We should help Iraq without using guns. It is hard to say what to do. We want our soldiers to be safe. But if we stay, we will make Iraq worse. Families are sad. The Al-Qaeda group will grow. People will hate the U.S. more. The war will last for a long time. That is all.

I do not agree with making it legal. It should be up to the churches. The constitution says church and state are separate. If the government tries to control it, this is against the constitution. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. I think the government should not decide what churches can make illegal. Separation of church and state is important. Making an amendment about this would be wrong and only restrict people, not the government. I do not think the federal government should be involved. The president wants this because of his Catholic beliefs, not for the good of society. It is up to the churches to decide. There is no good reason to make an amendment to ban it. It might even help the economy and society more than it would not.

I think the war in Iraq was not honestly planned by the government. They said the war was connected to the 2001 terrorist attacks, but this was not true. The government used emotions from the attacks to start the invasion in 2003.

I am against war in general, especially when fighting an enemy country without proof. The Vietnam War was similar. Both wars were about removing the enemy's government and trying to put a democratic one in place.

Many American soldiers died in both wars. The government did not plan well for the aftermath. They removed the Iraqi government but did not have a plan for what would happen next. This caused chaos and violence.

I think the government should have planned for all possible outcomes. The war is still going on in 2006, and American soldiers are still dying. The government also did not prepare the Iraqi government and police forces to handle the country.

The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful, but it will take many years to make a good democratic government. I think the government should have been more honest about this.

In the 2004 election, I thought about voting for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave the people of Iraq after taking away their government. But many American soldiers have died, and it is not clear if the war is worth the risk.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace. But it may not happen.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice. It is not something that people can control. It is not fair to take away rights because of something that is not their fault. I think it is not nice to take away rights based on something that people cannot change. I have always supported gay marriage. I do not think that politics or government should decide this. It is a personal choice, not a state or government decision. In my neighborhood, there are two or three gay couples. They are like any other family. They walk dogs and do normal things. I think it is silly for some people to say they can decide what marriage is. I think that people should be able to marry without being famous. I think that marriage should be private, not public. I do not think that people should be famous or on the front page if they marry. I think that marriage should be like any other personal choice.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everybody can see it. You cannot put bad things, like talk about blowing up things or shootings. If you do, people will think bad things about you. The school might hear about it and act. They cannot ignore it because something bad might happen. Sometimes, people say funny things on the internet. The school does not check social media like Facebook or Myspace. But if they hear about bad things, they must take it seriously. The school cannot friend students on Facebook or Myspace. It is not their job to watch what students do. But if the school hears about danger, they must act. They cannot watch phone calls or texts. They must take reports seriously. A teacher should not make a fake Facebook account to friend students. It is not their job to watch what students do. The school should not see pictures of students drinking. It is not their job to stop students from drinking.

I think the war has lasted too long.
The reason was good at first.
Make democracy in another country.
But, now we do it to show power.
Maybe it was also about George Bush's father and Saddam Hussein.
So, the purpose may have changed.
We started the war to show power.
But, now we fight to keep fighting.
We should stop the war.
Their government must take care of itself.
We spend too much money on this war.
We should use this money to help our own country.
We have problems like poverty and schools.
We need to fix those problems.
The war is not good for our budget.
We should stop the war.

Can I ask a question to clear something up?

The plan was stopped because someone went online and saw something on a student's profile.

Oh okay.

I don't think that was a privacy invasion. On sites like Myspace, if you post information, it can be seen by many people. You have to accept someone as a friend to see their profile.

I think it's good that someone saw the plan and stopped it. But it's hard to check everyone's profiles every day.

If someone is looking for a student planning something, that's different. But if someone is just looking at profiles, that's not good. I have Facebook too, and it worries me that strangers can see my information.

I don't want to be too private because I want to communicate with friends. But I only accept people I know. So, it's a tricky issue.

My roommate told me that her high school banned students from having Myspace. I don't think that was right.

I talk about the Iraq War. I feel bad when I talk about it. Many people say they were against it from the start. This is not important now. Many people think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and seventy percent of U.S. troops think we should leave. It was a disaster from the start. We cannot fix it easily. There is a big gap between the U.S. and the Middle East. The U.S. wants to bring democracy where it cannot exist. Saddam was bad, but we must think about the pros and cons. It is like quicksand. I do not see why we should stay. The administration has no good reasons to stay. I think we should leave now. Iraqis want us to leave. They think it is better. We will be the good guys if we leave. We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than now. No.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still happening in the United States.

Not only women, but also men can face it. For example, a woman might be qualified for a job, but people won't give it to her because it's not common for women to have high positions in business.

Men can also face discrimination. For example, a man who wants to stay home and care for children might be looked down on because society expects men to be the main money-maker.

In fashion, people might not take men seriously because they assume men don't understand women's fashion.

I think discrimination is happening in many fields. To change it, we need to promote good qualities of people who are often stereotyped against. We can't force change too quickly because people will resist it. Change takes time.

Sometimes, people might also discriminate against each other based on job type or where they grew up. For example, a man from a farm might be smart but have poor grammar. Other men might not trust him because of his grammar.

People in some places made marijuana a crime. They changed this to a small penalty, like a traffic ticket. This stopped people from getting arrested. This is good because it uses less money and time. Some cities changed this law because it saved money. They could use the money for schools and other programs. However, people should not smoke marijuana in public. It is not good for people to smoke in cars while driving. Also, not everyone reacts the same to drugs. Some people can control their use, but others cannot.

I say yes, because
Many things in the Catholic Church are old traditions.
They do the same things for a long time.
Tradition is good, but change is also important.
Many Catholics must go to church every week.
They follow rules very strictly.
Sometimes, the church does not like people who do not follow the rules.
For example, my parents could not marry in the Catholic church.
My father was an Episcopalian.
My mother was a Catholic.
The church does not accept people of other religions.
The church says to love others, but does not accept them.
This is not good.
Many teachers say to love others, but it is not true in practice.
The church teaches one thing, but does not do it.
This makes me feel bad.
Many people think priests should marry.
But I do not think this will stop bad things.
Some priests hurt children.
They do this even if they are married.
Marriage will not stop this.
I do not think the church should change this rule.

I don't know yet if I agree or disagree about this topic. It's hard to decide. I think the topic of marriage and the separation of church and state is difficult. I don't want to offend anyone. I think the government should not decide what marriage is. If two people say they are married, they should be treated the same. The government should not ask about their religion or the kind of marriage they have. If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. But I think it's silly to change the constitution to ban gay marriage. It's not a big enough cause for that. It's not important enough to change the constitution.

I was raised in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with being gay, but I think it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. I believe each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how that state feels about it. I think you should not disagree with that decision. Gay people should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals, so I think it should be legalized by each state.

I answered that question earlier. I do not think President Bush should decide for the whole country. I think the decision should be up to each individual state. I do not agree with his ban on gay marriage. He cannot decide how each state should run. He is going to be out of office in a couple of years. If a Democratic president lifts the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

No, I do not agree.

No, I don't agree.

It's okay.

That's fine.
I'm afraid to post bad things,

They can find it later.
Once on the internet,
You can't remove it.
School officials and police can check.
They make the school safe.
Parents trust the school is safe.
We practice lock downs.
It keeps us safe.
School officials do it to prevent bad things.
Like Columbine.
They make the school safe.
That's all.

At first, I supported the war because I was affected by 9/11. I wanted to create as much trouble as they did to us. But now I am against it. I don’t think it has helped. We should not be there if they can’t even get along with each other. We should leave. We were unprepared and did not have a good plan. We should not try to change their way of life. We just wanted revenge. President Bush declared war on Iraq because he wanted to go there. We did not have a clear plan for what to do after we went in. We should have had unity and a better plan. We were emotional and angry. We cannot change those people. They will always fight with each other. We are not making enough progress. We should leave. We cannot stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves by staying.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church should change some things. Many people are leaving the church because it is not accepting of certain things, like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the church changed to more modern thinking, it might keep more people. People disagree with the church on these issues, so they stop following it. I don't see why priests can't be married. They can have a job and family life, like other people.

I am not against gay marriage. I believe people are born this way. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for their feelings. It is wrong to say only men and women can marry. The federal government should not get involved. This is not a security or moral issue. It is a personal choice. The government should not decide for people what is right or wrong. It is their life, not the government's.

I think that gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason not to. Many people think that gay couples threaten heterosexual families. But it is different. They are like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same, but it is the same thing. Gay couples have the same rights as heterosexual couples. They should have the same legal rights, like marriage certificates. Gay couples should not be treated differently. The government should allow gay marriage in every state. The amendment should be changed to be about equality. President Bush has strong views on this topic. He believes it is against his religion. But morality differs from person to person. The government should not enforce religious standards. People should not be anti-gay just because they think gay people are damaged. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to experts, not just their neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Many illegal drugs have useful properties. For example, oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These drugs help people feel better. We use them because they are helpful. I think marijuana should also be allowed for medical use. It can help people feel better. Some people think marijuana is bad. They think it is as bad as heroine or cocaine. I do not agree. I think marijuana can be bad, too, but it is not as bad. People should not be afraid of it. We should remove the bad image of marijuana. If we do this, people might use it responsibly. They might use it for medical purposes.

Moreover, we should slowly make marijuana legal. This way, people will not abuse it. We should not make it legal all at once. People should first understand marijuana is not as bad as they think. When they do, they will use it responsibly.

I think the church has changed for the twenty-first century.
It is not so strict now.
I went to church every Sunday when I was young.
I wore cute dresses and matching shoes and purse.
I went to a private school.
We would go to church every weekend.
Now, they have a special mass for teenagers.
It is thirty minutes long.
People wear casual clothes, even in summer.
People come in beach clothes.
Families arrive late.
The church is more casual now.
People wear jeans and khakis in the morning.
The biggest change is the attitude towards the church.
I don't know about the politics of the church.
That's all I noticed.
[Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests dealing with pedophilia, do you think these could have been prevented if the church changed, for example, by allowing female priests or allowing priests to marry?]
No, I don't think it would have made a difference.
Some married men become pedophiles.
They have an attraction to young kids.
Even if priests were allowed to marry, it wouldn't help.
There are other religions where priests can marry.
If they want to be married and practice their faith, they should choose a different religion.
[Can you elaborate on your answer a little more?]
Regarding the pedophilia accusations, I think it's mostly genetics.
I don't think people become pedophiles because of how they're raised.
It's more about who they are.
Marriage can't change that.
If the church knew about the problem and covered it up, they are at fault.
But I don't think it happened in all cases.
[Do you have any other thoughts concerning the Catholic Church?]
No.

First, I liked idea. But, everyone still felt shock from September 11 attacks. We went to Iraq. Bush administration said Saddam had weapons. This was false. Bush lied. This is bad. Colin Powell also lied. This is an offense. Bush did not follow constitution. He wanted war. He wanted revenge. He also wanted more oil. This war is too long. We should leave. But, Iraq might have civil war. Other countries like Syria, Saudi Arabia might help. This might cause more problems. Iraq’s government is weak. Prime Minister has no control. Radicals fight for power. This is bad. I cannot explain this politely.

I talk about the War in Iraq. I think it is not good. It is like a big punishment. Iraq people did not start the attacks on the U.S. We are not sure why we are still in Iraq. We want to make democracy there. But democracy takes a long time. If we leave, Iraq people will not be happy. They will have to start over. This war is not like a real war. Congress did not make it. We are like a big bully with big guns. We want to show our power. But I think we should not call it a war. We should help Iraq without using guns. It is hard to say what to do. We want our soldiers to be safe. But if we stay, we will make Iraq worse. Families are sad. The Al-Qaeda group will grow. People will hate the U.S. more. The war will last for a long time. That is all.

I do not agree with making it legal. It should be up to the churches. The constitution says church and state are separate. If the government tries to control it, this is against the constitution. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. I think the government should not decide what churches can make illegal. Separation of church and state is important. Making an amendment about this would be wrong and only restrict people, not the government. I do not think the federal government should be involved. The president wants this because of his Catholic beliefs, not for the good of society. It is up to the churches to decide. There is no good reason to make an amendment to ban it. It might even help the economy and society more than it would not.

I think the war in Iraq was not honestly planned by the government. They said the war was connected to the 2001 terrorist attacks, but this was not true. The government used emotions from the attacks to start the invasion in 2003.

I am against war in general, especially when fighting an enemy country without proof. The Vietnam War was similar. Both wars were about removing the enemy's government and trying to put a democratic one in place.

Many American soldiers died in both wars. The government did not plan well for the aftermath. They removed the Iraqi government but did not have a plan for what would happen next. This caused chaos and violence.

I think the government should have planned for all possible outcomes. The war is still going on in 2006, and American soldiers are still dying. The government also did not prepare the Iraqi government and police forces to handle the country.

The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful, but it will take many years to make a good democratic government. I think the government should have been more honest about this.

In the 2004 election, I thought about voting for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave the people of Iraq after taking away their government. But many American soldiers have died, and it is not clear if the war is worth the risk.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace. But it may not happen.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice. It is not something that people can control. It is not fair to take away rights because of something that is not their fault. I think it is not nice to take away rights based on something that people cannot change. I have always supported gay marriage. I do not think that politics or government should decide this. It is a personal choice, not a state or government decision. In my neighborhood, there are two or three gay couples. They are like any other family. They walk dogs and do normal things. I think it is silly for some people to say they can decide what marriage is. I think that people should be able to marry without being famous. I think that marriage should be private, not public. I do not think that people should be famous or on the front page if they marry. I think that marriage should be like any other personal choice.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everybody can see it. You cannot put bad things, like talk about blowing up things or shootings. If you do, people will think bad things about you. The school might hear about it and act. They cannot ignore it because something bad might happen. Sometimes, people say funny things on the internet. The school does not check social media like Facebook or Myspace. But if they hear about bad things, they must take it seriously. The school cannot friend students on Facebook or Myspace. It is not their job to watch what students do. But if the school hears about danger, they must act. They cannot watch phone calls or texts. They must take reports seriously. A teacher should not make a fake Facebook account to friend students. It is not their job to watch what students do. The school should not see pictures of students drinking. It is not their job to stop students from drinking.

I think the war has lasted too long.
The reason was good at first.
Make democracy in another country.
But, now we do it to show power.
Maybe it was also about George Bush's father and Saddam Hussein.
So, the purpose may have changed.
We started the war to show power.
But, now we fight to keep fighting.
We should stop the war.
Their government must take care of itself.
We spend too much money on this war.
We should use this money to help our own country.
We have problems like poverty and schools.
We need to fix those problems.
The war is not good for our budget.
We should stop the war.

Can I ask a question to clear something up?

The plan was stopped because someone went online and saw something on a student's profile.

Oh okay.

I don't think that was a privacy invasion. On sites like Myspace, if you post information, it can be seen by many people. You have to accept someone as a friend to see their profile.

I think it's good that someone saw the plan and stopped it. But it's hard to check everyone's profiles every day.

If someone is looking for a student planning something, that's different. But if someone is just looking at profiles, that's not good. I have Facebook too, and it worries me that strangers can see my information.

I don't want to be too private because I want to communicate with friends. But I only accept people I know. So, it's a tricky issue.

My roommate told me that her high school banned students from having Myspace. I don't think that was right.

I talk about the Iraq War. I feel bad when I talk about it. Many people say they were against it from the start. This is not important now. Many people think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and seventy percent of U.S. troops think we should leave. It was a disaster from the start. We cannot fix it easily. There is a big gap between the U.S. and the Middle East. The U.S. wants to bring democracy where it cannot exist. Saddam was bad, but we must think about the pros and cons. It is like quicksand. I do not see why we should stay. The administration has no good reasons to stay. I think we should leave now. Iraqis want us to leave. They think it is better. We will be the good guys if we leave. We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but it will be better than now. No.

Yes, I think gender discrimination is still happening in the United States.

Not only women, but also men can face it. For example, a woman might be qualified for a job, but people won't give it to her because it's not common for women to have high positions in business.

Men can also face discrimination. For example, a man who wants to stay home and care for children might be looked down on because society expects men to be the main money-maker.

In fashion, people might not take men seriously because they assume men don't understand women's fashion.

I think discrimination is happening in many fields. To change it, we need to promote good qualities of people who are often stereotyped against. We can't force change too quickly because people will resist it. Change takes time.

Sometimes, people might also discriminate against each other based on job type or where they grew up. For example, a man from a farm might be smart but have poor grammar. Other men might not trust him because of his grammar.

People in some places made marijuana a crime. They changed this to a small penalty, like a traffic ticket. This stopped people from getting arrested. This is good because it uses less money and time. Some cities changed this law because it saved money. They could use the money for schools and other programs. However, people should not smoke marijuana in public. It is not good for people to smoke in cars while driving. Also, not everyone reacts the same to drugs. Some people can control their use, but others cannot.

I say yes, because
Many things in the Catholic Church are old traditions.
They do the same things for a long time.
Tradition is good, but change is also important.
Many Catholics must go to church every week.
They follow rules very strictly.
Sometimes, the church does not like people who do not follow the rules.
For example, my parents could not marry in the Catholic church.
My father was an Episcopalian.
My mother was a Catholic.
The church does not accept people of other religions.
The church says to love others, but does not accept them.
This is not good.
Many teachers say to love others, but it is not true in practice.
The church teaches one thing, but does not do it.
This makes me feel bad.
Many people think priests should marry.
But I do not think this will stop bad things.
Some priests hurt children.
They do this even if they are married.
Marriage will not stop this.
I do not think the church should change this rule.

I don't know yet if I agree or disagree about this topic. It's hard to decide. I think the topic of marriage and the separation of church and state is difficult. I don't want to offend anyone. I think the government should not decide what marriage is. If two people say they are married, they should be treated the same. The government should not ask about their religion or the kind of marriage they have. If all states agree, they should make it a federal law. But I think it's silly to change the constitution to ban gay marriage. It's not a big enough cause for that. It's not important enough to change the constitution.

I was raised in a Christian family. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with being gay, but I think it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national issue. I believe each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic, and many are Republican. Democratic states will likely support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how that state feels about it. I think you should not disagree with that decision. Gay people should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals, so I think it should be legalized by each state.

I answered that question earlier. I do not think President Bush should decide for the whole country. I think the decision should be up to each individual state. I do not agree with his ban on gay marriage. He cannot decide how each state should run. He is going to be out of office in a couple of years. If a Democratic president lifts the ban, it will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state. They will have to live with the decision, not the president.

No, I do not agree.

They make the school safe.
That's all.

At first, I supported the war because I was affected by 9/11. I wanted to create as much trouble as they did to us. But now I am against it. I don’t think it has helped. We should not be there if they can’t even get along with each other. We should leave. We were unprepared and did not have a good plan. We should not try to change their way of life. We just wanted revenge. President Bush declared war on Iraq because he wanted to go there. We did not have a clear plan for what to do after we went in. We should have had unity and a better plan. We were emotional and angry. We cannot change those people. They will always fight with each other. We are not making enough progress. We should leave. We cannot stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves by staying.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church should change some things. Many people are leaving the church because it is not accepting of certain things, like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old-fashioned. If the church changed to more modern thinking, it might keep more people. People disagree with the church on these issues, so they stop following it. I don't see why priests can't be married. They can have a job and family life, like other people.

I am not against gay marriage. I believe people are born this way. It is not a choice. They should not be blamed for their feelings. It is wrong to say only men and women can marry. The federal government should not get involved. This is not a security or moral issue. It is a personal choice. The government should not decide for people what is right or wrong. It is their life, not the government's.

I think that gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason not to. Many people think that gay couples threaten heterosexual families. But it is different. They are like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are not the same, but it is the same thing. Gay couples have the same rights as heterosexual couples. They should have the same legal rights, like marriage certificates. Gay couples should not be treated differently. The government should allow gay marriage in every state. The amendment should be changed to be about equality. President Bush has strong views on this topic. He believes it is against his religion. But morality differs from person to person. The government should not enforce religious standards. People should not be anti-gay just because they think gay people are damaged. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to experts, not just their neighbors.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Many illegal drugs have useful properties. For example, oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These drugs help people feel better. We use them because they are helpful. I think marijuana should also be allowed for medical use. It can help people feel better. Some people think marijuana is bad. They think it is as bad as heroine or cocaine. I do not agree. I think marijuana can be bad, too, but it is not as bad. People should not be afraid of it. We should remove the bad image of marijuana. If we do this, people might use it responsibly. They might use it for medical purposes.

Moreover, we should slowly make marijuana legal. This way, people will not abuse it. We should not make it legal all at once. People should first understand marijuana is not as bad as they think. When they do, they will use it responsibly.

I think the church has changed for the twenty-first century.
It is not so strict now.
I went to church every Sunday when I was young.
I wore cute dresses and matching shoes and purse.
I went to a private school.
We would go to church every weekend.
Now, they have a special mass for teenagers.
It is thirty minutes long.
People wear casual clothes, even in summer.
People come in beach clothes.
Families arrive late.
The church is more casual now.
People wear jeans and khakis in the morning.
The biggest change is the attitude towards the church.
I don't know about the politics of the church.
That's all I noticed.
[Regarding the accusations against Catholic priests dealing with pedophilia, do you think these could have been prevented if the church changed, for example, by allowing female priests or allowing priests to marry?]
No, I don't think it would have made a difference.
Some married men become pedophiles.
They have an attraction to young kids.
Even if priests were allowed to marry, it wouldn't help.
There are other religions where priests can marry.
If they want to be married and practice their faith, they should choose a different religion.
[Can you elaborate on your answer a little more?]
Regarding the pedophilia accusations, I think it's mostly genetics.
I don't think people become pedophiles because of how they're raised.
It's more about who they are.
Marriage can't change that.
If the church knew about the problem and covered it up, they are at fault.
But I don't think it happened in all cases.
[Do you have any other thoughts concerning the Catholic Church?]
No.

First, I liked idea. But, everyone still felt shock from September 11 attacks. We went to Iraq. Bush administration said Saddam had weapons. This was false. Bush lied. This is bad. Colin Powell also lied. This is an offense. Bush did not follow constitution. He wanted war. He wanted revenge. He also wanted more oil. This war is too long. We should leave. But, Iraq might have civil war. Other countries like Syria, Saudi Arabia might help. This might cause more problems. Iraq’s government is weak. Prime Minister has no control. Radicals fight for power. This is bad. I cannot explain this politely.

I talk about the War in Iraq. I think it is not good. It is like a big punishment. Iraq people did not start the attacks on the U.S. We are not sure why we are still in Iraq. We want to make democracy there. But democracy takes a long time. If we leave, Iraq people will not be happy. They will have to start over. This war is not like a real war. Congress did not make it. We are like a big bully with big guns. We want to show our power. But I think we should not call it a war. We should help Iraq without using guns. It is hard to say what to do. We want our soldiers to be safe. But if we stay, we will make Iraq worse. Families are sad. The Al-Qaeda group will grow. People will hate the U.S. more. The war will last for a long time. That is all.

I do not agree with making it legal. It should be up to the churches. The constitution says church and state are separate. If the government tries to control it, this is against the constitution. Most Catholics and Christians do not support it. I think the government should not decide what churches can make illegal. Separation of church and state is important. Making an amendment about this would be wrong and only restrict people, not the government. I do not think the federal government should be involved. The president wants this because of his Catholic beliefs, not for the good of society. It is up to the churches to decide. There is no good reason to make an amendment to ban it. It might even help the economy and society more than it would not.

I think the war in Iraq was not honestly planned by the government. They said the war was connected to the 2001 terrorist attacks, but this was not true. The government used emotions from the attacks to start the invasion in 2003.

I am against war in general, especially when fighting an enemy country without proof. The Vietnam War was similar. Both wars were about removing the enemy's government and trying to put a democratic one in place.

Many American soldiers died in both wars. The government did not plan well for the aftermath. They removed the Iraqi government but did not have a plan for what would happen next. This caused chaos and violence.

I think the government should have planned for all possible outcomes. The war is still going on in 2006, and American soldiers are still dying. The government also did not prepare the Iraqi government and police forces to handle the country.

The government made it seem like the war would be short and successful, but it will take many years to make a good democratic government. I think the government should have been more honest about this.

In the 2004 election, I thought about voting for George Bush to finish what he started. It is hard to leave the people of Iraq after taking away their government. But many American soldiers have died, and it is not clear if the war is worth the risk.

I hope the war ends soon and there is peace. But it may not happen.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. I think it is a personal choice. It is not something that people can control. It is not fair to take away rights because of something that is not their fault. I think it is not nice to take away rights based on something that people cannot change. I have always supported gay marriage. I do not think that politics or government should decide this. It is a personal choice, not a state or government decision. In my neighborhood, there are two or three gay couples. They are like any other family. They walk dogs and do normal things. I think it is silly for some people to say they can decide what marriage is. I think that people should be able to marry without being famous. I think that marriage should be private, not public. I do not think that people should be famous or on the front page if they marry. I think that marriage should be like any other personal choice.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everybody can see it. You cannot put bad things, like talk about blowing up things or shootings. If you do, people will think bad things about you. The school might hear about it and act. They cannot ignore it because something bad might happen. Sometimes, people say funny things on the internet. The school does not check social media like Facebook or Myspace. But if they hear about bad things, they must take it seriously. The school cannot friend students on Facebook or Myspace. It is not their job to watch what students do. But if the school hears about danger, they must act. They cannot watch phone calls or texts. They must take reports seriously. A teacher should not make a fake Facebook account to friend students. It is not their job to watch what students do. The school should not see pictures of students drinking. It is not their job to stop students from drinking.

If someone is looking for a student planning something, that's different. But if someone is just looking at profiles, that's not good. I have Facebook too, and it worries me that strangers can see my information.

I don't want to be too private because I want to communicate with friends. But I only accept people I know. So, it's a tricky issue.

My roommate told me that her high school banned students from having Myspace. I don't think that was right.

I talk about the Iraq War. I feel bad when I talk about it. Many people say they were against it from the start. This is not important now. Many people think it was a bad idea. Eighty percent of Iraqis and seventy percent of U.S. troops think we should leave. It was a disaster from the start. We cannot fix it easily. There is a big gap between the U.S. and the Middle East. Yes, I think gender discrimination is still happening in the United States.

Not only women, but also men can face it. For example, a woman might be qualified for a job, but people won't give it to her because it's not common for women to have high positions in business.

Men can also face discrimination. For example, a man who wants to stay home and care for children might be looked down on because society expects men to be the main money-maker.

In fashion, people might not take men seriously because they assume men don't understand women's fashion.

I think discrimination is happening in many fields. To change it, we need to promote good qualities of people who are often stereotyped against. We can't force change too quickly because people will resist it. Change takes time.

Sometimes, people might also discriminate against each other based on job type or where they grew up. For example, a man from a farm might be smart but have poor grammar. Other men might not trust him because of his grammar.

People in some places made marijuana a crime. They changed this to a small penalty, like a traffic ticket. This stopped people from getting arrested. This is good because it uses less money and time. Some cities changed this law because it saved money. They could use the money for schools and other programs. However, people should not smoke marijuana in public. It is not good for people to smoke in cars while driving. Also, not everyone reacts the same to drugs. Some people can control their use, but others cannot.
