transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are leaving because the Church is not accepting of some things. The Church has strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old and may not fit with people's new beliefs. If the Church changes, it might keep more followers. Some people are upset that the Church does not agree with them on these issues. They feel the Church has wrong views. The Church is against abortion, so if you support it, you might not feel comfortable. The same is true for gay marriage. I don't see why priests can't be married or why there can't be female priests. It might not have prevented the problems the Church has faced. Many people believe priests should have family lives too.

I am okay with gay marriage. Gay people should not be blamed for their feelings. It's not a choice. Like others, they are born this way. It's wrong to say people of the same sex cannot marry. The federal government should not interfere. This is not about security or morals. It's not their business. Gay people should not be punished.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason to say it should not be. Many people think that gay couples threaten the family. But it is not the same. It is like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are different, but they are both coins. Some people think gay couples should not have the same rights as heterosexual couples. This includes rights like property taxes and healthcare. If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot visit you if you are sick. This is because they are not considered family. I think this is silly. Scientific studies show that gay couples are similar to heterosexual couples. They have the same success rates. They have the same factors that make relationships happy. Gay couples just want a marriage certificate, not a church ceremony. There should be no issue with this. It is like segregation, separate but unequal. Many people worry about adoption and community issues. But gay couples are the same as heterosexual couples. They can be community involved or not. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. His views are mostly based on his religion. But morality is not the same for everyone. It is unfair to ignore the culture and morality of other groups. It is hypocritical for the government to create laws based on the beliefs of religious groups. Many people are anti-gay because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to institutions that do research instead of popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I think illegal drugs can be good for people if they are used correctly. For example, drugs like oxycodone and Vicodin are illegal but we use them because they help people. I think we should allow marijuana for medical use. It is not like other illegal drugs like heroin. I think we should gradually make it legal so people do not misuse it. People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we remove this bad image, people might use it safely and for medical reasons.

The church has changed with the times.
It is less strict than before.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute clothes and shoes, and a purse.
I went with friends from private school.
Now, the services are shorter and more relaxed.
People wear casual clothes.
In summer, families come late, sometimes in beachwear.
At morning services, people wear jeans and khakis.
I do not know about the church's politics.
Regarding the accusations, I do not think changes could have prevented them.
Married men can still be pedophiles.
The attraction is genetic, not due to being married.
The church could not change this.
If priests knew about it and covered it up, they are wrong.
But not all churches allow priests to marry.
If they want to be married and practice their faith, they should choose a different religion.
The church could not prevent these problems.

I first thought okay about the war in Iraq. But I think everyone was still upset from the September 11th attacks. I was not happy with the reasons for the war. The Bush administration used it to fight Saddam Hussein. They said he had weapons of mass destruction but that was not true. I think the administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell did not believe the evidence when he spoke at the UN. I think this is a serious crime. The Bush administration does not care about the constitution. I think they want to continue the war to get more oil. I think it has gone on too long. But if we stop now, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN and the US want other countries to help. But this might cause more problems. The Iraqi government is not working well. The Prime Minister does not control the political process. Radical groups are fighting for power. I do not know what to say nicely about this.

I talk about the War in Iraq.
I talk about it because I feel it is not fair.
I feel like it is just a way to get back at Iraq. Many think Iraq did the attacks on the U.S. on 9/11.
I do not like the War on Iraq. I do not know many details about it.
We want to help Iraq become like the U.S. We also want to get oil from there.
But it is not a good reason to stay. It makes many people angry.
If we stay, we must try to build democracy there. This will take a long time.
If we leave, Iraq will be angry with us. We will leave them to start over.
I think the war should continue. I do not think it is a real war. Congress did not declare it.
I think it is like the Vietnam War. It was not declared and now it is called meaningless.
I feel bad for Bush. It makes him look bad.
I feel bad for the soldiers' families. Their sons and daughters are in Iraq. I want them to be safe.
But I also feel bad for the people in Iraq. We are trying to change their culture. This will make things worse.
I think the whole thing will go on for many years.
That is what I think about the War in Iraq.

I do not think it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal.
I believe it is up to churches to decide this.
The constitution says separation of church and state.
This means the government should not decide what churches can do.
People who want to make it illegal are choosing one church's beliefs over others.
The government should not decide what is legal or illegal for churches.
The government should not make an amendment about this.
Making this amendment would be wrong.
It would restrict people, not the government.
The government should not be involved in this issue.
The president is pushing for this amendment because he is Catholic.
Other religions should not be chosen over his.
Churches should decide this, not the president or government.
There is no good reason for an amendment to make it illegal.
This might help the economy and society.

The war in Iraq started in 2003. I did not think the government was completely honest about the reasons for war. The government said it was because of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. But this was not true. The war and the terrorist attacks were not connected. The government made people feel angry and wanted to go to war because of the attacks. I do not like war, especially when it is a preemptive strike. The war was like the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died. The government removed Iraq's government and did not plan for what would happen after. Iraq is still not peaceful. The American government should have learned from past mistakes. I think the war was not a good idea. If the government could not plan for the future, they should not have gone to war. Many American soldiers are still dying. The government said it would be a short and successful war. But it is a long and hard process to create a new government. Democracy in our own country took a long time. The government made it seem easy. I was thinking about voting in the 2004 election. I thought about voting for George Bush because he started the war. But it was hard to abandon Iraq after being there for so long. The United States took away Iraq's government and way of life. We cannot abandon them now. But there is also the issue of American soldiers' lives and how many is too many to lose. The main reason for invading Iraq was oil. The United States uses oil from Iraq. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. Other countries with weapons of mass destruction were not attacked. The government should be more truthful and careful in making decisions. I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq. But probably not.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. It is a personal choice. Some people think it is not, but I believe it is. I think it is not fair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. It is not right.

I think politics and government should not decide about marriage. It is a personal thing, not a political thing.

In my neighborhood, there are many gay couples. They live like other families. They walk their dogs and live happy lives. They should have the same rights as others.

I do not think the government should decide how people live their lives. They should not decide about marriage.

Some people think being gay is because of how you grow up. I do not think this is true. I think it is because of how your brain works.

Marriage should be a personal choice. If two people love each other, they should be able to marry. They should not have to tell anyone or make it public.

I do not think people should marry just to see their names in the news. It should be a private thing.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it.
As a Resident Advisor, I have faced this issue before.
You put something online, people will see it and form opinions about you.
If you talk about bad things like blowing things up or shootings, people might think you are serious.
The internet is seen by many people. If you are friends with someone on Facebook, you get their updates.
When something serious happens, the school must take it seriously.
Teachers should not friend their students on Facebook or other social media.
If a student posts something dangerous, the school must take it seriously.
If a teacher or student finds something dangerous, they must report it.
The school does not invade privacy if they check social media to check for danger.
However, teachers should not make fake accounts to check students.
If a student posts something dangerous, the school must act.
The school should not monitor private messages like texts or IMs.
Teachers should not be friends with students on social media.
The school should only check social media to find dangerous posts.

The war has lasted too long. The goal was to help another country have a fair political system. This was good. But now, it seems like we are fighting for the sake of being a powerful country. The original reason was also mixed in with personal matters. The first few months showed our purpose. But the war has been going on for too long. We should stop. The government in that country needs to stand alone. We have our own problems, like poverty and schools. We should fix those problems. The money we have is not enough. We need to stop the war. It's been going on too long.

Can I ask a question to understand better? Why information on the internet can be a problem? If you post information on the internet, it's almost like giving it to everyone. Even on Myspace, people can see your profile if you accept them as friends. So, if that helps prevent a bad situation, is it good or bad? I think it's tough to decide. If one person looks at every student's profile all day, it seems like discrimination. But if they find something important, it might be good. I use Facebook, and I know people can see too much. I saw a TV show where someone got a girl's screen name and talked to her quickly. I don't know if that's good or bad. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know, but sometimes people still know too much about me. It's hard to decide how to use the internet. My roommate's high school banned Myspace. I don't think officials had the right to tell students they couldn't have it.

I have two reasons to talk about the Iraq War.
First, I feel bad talking about it.
I do not want to sound like everyone else who says "I was against it from the beginning."
I was against it, but it is not important now.
People everywhere think it was a bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world's people think it was a bad idea.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was a bad idea.
Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was a bad idea.
The situation there is a disaster.
It was a disaster before we went in.
Pulling out will also be a disaster.
There is no easy way to handle the Middle East.
It is a big gap between the U.S. and Middle Eastern countries.
The U.S. thinks it can bring democracy to an area where it is not wanted.
Saddam was a bad leader, but we should consider the pros and cons before invading.
I do not know what to say about the Iraq War.
I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq.
I have not heard a good reason to stay.
I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
I think they know what is best for them.
If they ask us to leave and we do, we will be good guys.
Even then, we will not be good guys in the Middle East.
Leaving will be better than where we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. Women face many challenges in their jobs. For example, sometimes they cannot get promoted because people think women should not be in charge. Men also face problems. For example, if a man stays at home to take care of children, people might look down on him. In the fashion industry, men might not be taken seriously because society thinks only women understand fashion. I think society has changed a lot, but it takes time to change. We should continue to work slowly to help people understand that everyone can be successful, no matter their gender.

In Denver, they decriminalized marijuana. This means they made it not a crime. Before, it was a criminal offense. Now, if someone is caught, they get a ticket. This is different from being arrested and taken to jail. People worry about job interviews and other things, but this is better than having a drug charge. Decriminalization saves money for the city. The city can spend the money on education and social programs. Not everyone likes marijuana. It's important to think about how it affects people's lives. Alcohol and marijuana both have bad effects. People react differently to substances. It's hard to say what the effects will be.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are traditional.
This is good.
But also important to change.
Many Catholics must go to church each week.
They are strict.
Sometimes they do not accept others.
My parents could not marry in Catholic church.
My mom was Catholic, dad was Episcopalian.
They say to love others.
But they do not accept others.
This is not good.
I feel Catholic teachings are outdated.
They do not change.
I think priests should marry.
But pedophilia is a different problem.
Marrying would not stop it.
Probably would happen anyway.

I am not sure if I agree or disagree.
I think this topic is difficult to discuss.
I think it is hard to talk about without hurting someone's feelings.
I think the government should treat all unions the same.
I think there should not be a special definition for marriage.
I think that is like saying that a government should look at a person's religion.
I think when people get married, it is like a civil union.
I think it is just two people who are together.
I think that gay marriage should just be a civil union too.
I think if all the states agree, then it should be a federal law.
I think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not good.
I think the constitution should not be changed for this reason.
I think it is not important enough to change the constitution.
I think the government should not look at the type of marriage.
I think people should just be together.
I think it is like a civil union.
I think it is just two people.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is not easy for me to accept. I have many gay friends. I think they should be able to marry if they want. I do not think this should be a national problem. It should be decided by each state. I think states with many democrats will want gay marriage. If you live there, you should not argue with that. Homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. The president should not decide for everyone. I do not agree with Bush's ban on it. States should decide. The president should not control all states. He does not live in every state. Some things should be decided by each state. Bush will leave office soon. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back and forth. The decision should be up to each state. They will live with the decision, not the president. I do not agree with Bush's ban.

Myspace is a public space. People can see what others post. School officials should not look for students doing bad things, but they should look if they have information about school safety. If they find something that makes the school safer, then it's good. However, if they just look to catch students, it's bad. They should not look just for bad things. They should look for things that might cause trouble. They should also check for signs of bad things that might happen, like school shootings. School officials should make the school safe. They should do this by looking for signs of trouble and preventing it. They should also make sure students are safe by practicing safety drills. All this is to make sure students are safe. That's what school officials should do.

I first thought war was good because of 9/11. I wanted to do harm, like they did to us. But I now think it was a mistake. I think we did not plan well. We went in without a plan. I think it has not helped. People over there fight each other. They cannot fight with us. I think we should not be there. I think they do not want to improve their country. They just want us to leave. I think we went there for revenge. I think President Bush wanted to go. People wanted it. I think we could not let Iraq attack us and rebuild. But we should have planned better. We did not know what to do. We did not have unity. I think we cannot change those people. I think they will always fight. We are not helping by staying there. It is like hurting ourselves.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are leaving because the Church is not accepting of some things. The Church has strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old and may not fit with people's new beliefs. If the Church changes, it might keep more followers. Some people are upset that the Church does not agree with them on these issues. They feel the Church has wrong views. The Church is against abortion, so if you support it, you might not feel comfortable. The same is true for gay marriage. I don't see why priests can't be married or why there can't be female priests. It might not have prevented the problems the Church has faced. Many people believe priests should have family lives too.

I am okay with gay marriage. Gay people should not be blamed for their feelings. It's not a choice. Like others, they are born this way. It's wrong to say people of the same sex cannot marry. The federal government should not interfere. This is not about security or morals. It's not their business. Gay people should not be punished.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason to say it should not be. Many people think that gay couples threaten the family. But it is not the same. It is like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are different, but they are both coins. Some people think gay couples should not have the same rights as heterosexual couples. This includes rights like property taxes and healthcare. If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot visit you if you are sick. This is because they are not considered family. I think this is silly. Scientific studies show that gay couples are similar to heterosexual couples. They have the same success rates. They have the same factors that make relationships happy. Gay couples just want a marriage certificate, not a church ceremony. There should be no issue with this. It is like segregation, separate but unequal. Many people worry about adoption and community issues. But gay couples are the same as heterosexual couples. They can be community involved or not. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. His views are mostly based on his religion. But morality is not the same for everyone. It is unfair to ignore the culture and morality of other groups. It is hypocritical for the government to create laws based on the beliefs of religious groups. Many people are anti-gay because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to institutions that do research instead of popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I think illegal drugs can be good for people if they are used correctly. For example, drugs like oxycodone and Vicodin are illegal but we use them because they help people. I think we should allow marijuana for medical use. It is not like other illegal drugs like heroin. I think we should gradually make it legal so people do not misuse it. People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we remove this bad image, people might use it safely and for medical reasons.

The church has changed with the times.
It is less strict than before.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute clothes and shoes, and a purse.
I went with friends from private school.
Now, the services are shorter and more relaxed.
People wear casual clothes.
In summer, families come late, sometimes in beachwear.
At morning services, people wear jeans and khakis.
I do not know about the church's politics.
Regarding the accusations, I do not think changes could have prevented them.
Married men can still be pedophiles.
The attraction is genetic, not due to being married.
The church could not change this.
If priests knew about it and covered it up, they are wrong.
But not all churches allow priests to marry.
If they want to be married and practice their faith, they should choose a different religion.
The church could not prevent these problems.

I first thought okay about the war in Iraq. But I think everyone was still upset from the September 11th attacks. I was not happy with the reasons for the war. The Bush administration used it to fight Saddam Hussein. They said he had weapons of mass destruction but that was not true. I think the administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell did not believe the evidence when he spoke at the UN. I think this is a serious crime. The Bush administration does not care about the constitution. I think they want to continue the war to get more oil. I think it has gone on too long. But if we stop now, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN and the US want other countries to help. But this might cause more problems. The Iraqi government is not working well. The Prime Minister does not control the political process. Radical groups are fighting for power. I do not know what to say nicely about this.

I talk about it because I feel it is not fair.
I feel like it is just a way to get back at Iraq. Many think Iraq did the attacks on the U.S. on 9/11.
I do not like the War on Iraq. I do not know many details about it.
We want to help Iraq become like the U.S. We also want to get oil from there.
But it is not a good reason to stay. It makes many people angry.
If we stay, we must try to build democracy there. This will take a long time.
If we leave, Iraq will be angry with us. We will leave them to start over.
I think the war should continue. I do not think it is a real war. Congress did not declare it.
I think it is like the Vietnam War. It was not declared and now it is called meaningless.
I feel bad for Bush. It makes him look bad.
I feel bad for the soldiers' families. Their sons and daughters are in Iraq. I want them to be safe.
But I also feel bad for the people in Iraq. We are trying to change their culture. This will make things worse.
I think the whole thing will go on for many years.
That is what I think about the War in Iraq.

I do not think it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal.
I believe it is up to churches to decide this.
The constitution says separation of church and state.
This means the government should not decide what churches can do.
People who want to make it illegal are choosing one church's beliefs over others.
The government should not decide what is legal or illegal for churches.
The government should not make an amendment about this.
Making this amendment would be wrong.
It would restrict people, not the government.
The government should not be involved in this issue.
The president is pushing for this amendment because he is Catholic.
Other religions should not be chosen over his.
Churches should decide this, not the president or government.
There is no good reason for an amendment to make it illegal.
This might help the economy and society.

The war in Iraq started in 2003. I did not think the government was completely honest about the reasons for war. The government said it was because of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. But this was not true. The war and the terrorist attacks were not connected. The government made people feel angry and wanted to go to war because of the attacks. I do not like war, especially when it is a preemptive strike. The war was like the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died. The government removed Iraq's government and did not plan for what would happen after. Iraq is still not peaceful. The American government should have learned from past mistakes. I think the war was not a good idea. If the government could not plan for the future, they should not have gone to war. Many American soldiers are still dying. The government said it would be a short and successful war. But it is a long and hard process to create a new government. Democracy in our own country took a long time. The government made it seem easy. I was thinking about voting in the 2004 election. I thought about voting for George Bush because he started the war. But it was hard to abandon Iraq after being there for so long. The United States took away Iraq's government and way of life. We cannot abandon them now. But there is also the issue of American soldiers' lives and how many is too many to lose. The main reason for invading Iraq was oil. The United States uses oil from Iraq. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. Other countries with weapons of mass destruction were not attacked. The government should be more truthful and careful in making decisions. I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq. But probably not.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. It is a personal choice. Some people think it is not, but I believe it is. I think it is not fair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. It is not right.

I think politics and government should not decide about marriage. It is a personal thing, not a political thing.

In my neighborhood, there are many gay couples. They live like other families. They walk their dogs and live happy lives. They should have the same rights as others.

I do not think the government should decide how people live their lives. They should not decide about marriage.

Some people think being gay is because of how you grow up. I do not think this is true. I think it is because of how your brain works.

Marriage should be a personal choice. If two people love each other, they should be able to marry. They should not have to tell anyone or make it public.

I do not think people should marry just to see their names in the news. It should be a private thing.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it.
As a Resident Advisor, I have faced this issue before.
You put something online, people will see it and form opinions about you.
If you talk about bad things like blowing things up or shootings, people might think you are serious.
The internet is seen by many people. If you are friends with someone on Facebook, you get their updates.
When something serious happens, the school must take it seriously.
Teachers should not friend their students on Facebook or other social media.
If a student posts something dangerous, the school must take it seriously.
If a teacher or student finds something dangerous, they must report it.
The school does not invade privacy if they check social media to check for danger.
However, teachers should not make fake accounts to check students.
If a student posts something dangerous, the school must act.
The school should not monitor private messages like texts or IMs.
Teachers should not be friends with students on social media.
The school should only check social media to find dangerous posts.

The war has lasted too long. The goal was to help another country have a fair political system. This was good. But now, it seems like we are fighting for the sake of being a powerful country. The original reason was also mixed in with personal matters. The first few months showed our purpose. But the war has been going on for too long. We should stop. The government in that country needs to stand alone. We have our own problems, like poverty and schools. We should fix those problems. The money we have is not enough. We need to stop the war. It's been going on too long.

Can I ask a question to understand better? Why information on the internet can be a problem? If you post information on the internet, it's almost like giving it to everyone. Even on Myspace, people can see your profile if you accept them as friends. So, if that helps prevent a bad situation, is it good or bad? I think it's tough to decide. If one person looks at every student's profile all day, it seems like discrimination. But if they find something important, it might be good. I use Facebook, and I know people can see too much. I saw a TV show where someone got a girl's screen name and talked to her quickly. I don't know if that's good or bad. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know, but sometimes people still know too much about me. It's hard to decide how to use the internet. My roommate's high school banned Myspace. I don't think officials had the right to tell students they couldn't have it.

I have two reasons to talk about the Iraq War.
First, I feel bad talking about it.
I do not want to sound like everyone else who says "I was against it from the beginning."
I was against it, but it is not important now.
People everywhere think it was a bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world's people think it was a bad idea.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was a bad idea.
Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was a bad idea.
The situation there is a disaster.
It was a disaster before we went in.
Pulling out will also be a disaster.
There is no easy way to handle the Middle East.
It is a big gap between the U.S. and Middle Eastern countries.
The U.S. thinks it can bring democracy to an area where it is not wanted.
Saddam was a bad leader, but we should consider the pros and cons before invading.
I do not know what to say about the Iraq War.
I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq.
I have not heard a good reason to stay.
I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
I think they know what is best for them.
If they ask us to leave and we do, we will be good guys.
Even then, we will not be good guys in the Middle East.
Leaving will be better than where we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. Women face many challenges in their jobs. For example, sometimes they cannot get promoted because people think women should not be in charge. Men also face problems. For example, if a man stays at home to take care of children, people might look down on him. In the fashion industry, men might not be taken seriously because society thinks only women understand fashion. I think society has changed a lot, but it takes time to change. We should continue to work slowly to help people understand that everyone can be successful, no matter their gender.

In Denver, they decriminalized marijuana. This means they made it not a crime. Before, it was a criminal offense. Now, if someone is caught, they get a ticket. This is different from being arrested and taken to jail. People worry about job interviews and other things, but this is better than having a drug charge. Decriminalization saves money for the city. The city can spend the money on education and social programs. Not everyone likes marijuana. It's important to think about how it affects people's lives. Alcohol and marijuana both have bad effects. People react differently to substances. It's hard to say what the effects will be.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are traditional.
This is good.
But also important to change.
Many Catholics must go to church each week.
They are strict.
Sometimes they do not accept others.
My parents could not marry in Catholic church.
My mom was Catholic, dad was Episcopalian.
They say to love others.
But they do not accept others.
This is not good.
I feel Catholic teachings are outdated.
They do not change.
I think priests should marry.
But pedophilia is a different problem.
Marrying would not stop it.
Probably would happen anyway.

I am not sure if I agree or disagree.
I think this topic is difficult to discuss.
I think it is hard to talk about without hurting someone's feelings.
I think the government should treat all unions the same.
I think there should not be a special definition for marriage.
I think that is like saying that a government should look at a person's religion.
I think when people get married, it is like a civil union.
I think it is just two people who are together.
I think that gay marriage should just be a civil union too.
I think if all the states agree, then it should be a federal law.
I think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not good.
I think the constitution should not be changed for this reason.
I think it is not important enough to change the constitution.
I think the government should not look at the type of marriage.
I think people should just be together.
I think it is like a civil union.
I think it is just two people.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is not easy for me to accept. I have many gay friends. I think they should be able to marry if they want. I do not think this should be a national problem. It should be decided by each state. I think states with many democrats will want gay marriage. If you live there, you should not argue with that. Homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. The president should not decide for everyone. I do not agree with Bush's ban on it. States should decide. The president should not control all states. He does not live in every state. Some things should be decided by each state. Bush will leave office soon. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back and forth. The decision should be up to each state. They will live with the decision, not the president. I do not agree with Bush's ban.

Myspace is a public space. People can see what others post. School officials should not look for students doing bad things, but they should look if they have information about school safety. If they find something that makes the school safer, then it's good. However, if they just look to catch students, it's bad. They should not look just for bad things. They should look for things that might cause trouble. They should also check for signs of bad things that might happen, like school shootings. School officials should make the school safe. They should do this by looking for signs of trouble and preventing it. They should also make sure students are safe by practicing safety drills. All this is to make sure students are safe. That's what school officials should do.

I first thought war was good because of 9/11. I wanted to do harm, like they did to us. But I now think it was a mistake. I think we did not plan well. We went in without a plan. I think it has not helped. People over there fight each other. They cannot fight with us. I think we should not be there. I think they do not want to improve their country. They just want us to leave. I think we went there for revenge. I think President Bush wanted to go. People wanted it. I think we could not let Iraq attack us and rebuild. But we should have planned better. We did not know what to do. We did not have unity. I think we cannot change those people. I think they will always fight. We are not helping by staying there. It is like hurting ourselves.

transformed_texts: I think the Catholic Church needs to change in some ways. Many people are leaving because the Church is not accepting of some things. The Church has strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion, and birth control. These views are old and may not fit with people's new beliefs. If the Church changes, it might keep more followers. Some people are upset that the Church does not agree with them on these issues. They feel the Church has wrong views. The Church is against abortion, so if you support it, you might not feel comfortable. The same is true for gay marriage. I don't see why priests can't be married or why there can't be female priests. It might not have prevented the problems the Church has faced. Many people believe priests should have family lives too.

I am okay with gay marriage. Gay people should not be blamed for their feelings. It's not a choice. Like others, they are born this way. It's wrong to say people of the same sex cannot marry. The federal government should not interfere. This is not about security or morals. It's not their business. Gay people should not be punished.

I believe that gay marriage should be legal. There is no good reason to say it should not be. Many people think that gay couples threaten the family. But it is not the same. It is like two sides of the same coin. Heads and tails are different, but they are both coins. Some people think gay couples should not have the same rights as heterosexual couples. This includes rights like property taxes and healthcare. If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot visit you if you are sick. This is because they are not considered family. I think this is silly. Scientific studies show that gay couples are similar to heterosexual couples. They have the same success rates. They have the same factors that make relationships happy. Gay couples just want a marriage certificate, not a church ceremony. There should be no issue with this. It is like segregation, separate but unequal. Many people worry about adoption and community issues. But gay couples are the same as heterosexual couples. They can be community involved or not. The federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. President Bush has strong views on gay marriage. His views are mostly based on his religion. But morality is not the same for everyone. It is unfair to ignore the culture and morality of other groups. It is hypocritical for the government to create laws based on the beliefs of religious groups. Many people are anti-gay because they think gay people are damaged. But this is not true. The American Psychological Association says this is not true. People should listen to institutions that do research instead of popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy. I think illegal drugs can be good for people if they are used correctly. For example, drugs like oxycodone and Vicodin are illegal but we use them because they help people. I think we should allow marijuana for medical use. It is not like other illegal drugs like heroin. I think we should gradually make it legal so people do not misuse it. People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we remove this bad image, people might use it safely and for medical reasons.

The church has changed with the times.
It is less strict than before.
When I was young, I went to church every Sunday.
I wore cute clothes and shoes, and a purse.
I went with friends from private school.
Now, the services are shorter and more relaxed.
People wear casual clothes.
In summer, families come late, sometimes in beachwear.
At morning services, people wear jeans and khakis.
I do not know about the church's politics.
Regarding the accusations, I do not think changes could have prevented them.
Married men can still be pedophiles.
The attraction is genetic, not due to being married.
The church could not change this.
If priests knew about it and covered it up, they are wrong.
But not all churches allow priests to marry.
If they want to be married and practice their faith, they should choose a different religion.
The church could not prevent these problems.

I first thought okay about the war in Iraq. But I think everyone was still upset from the September 11th attacks. I was not happy with the reasons for the war. The Bush administration used it to fight Saddam Hussein. They said he had weapons of mass destruction but that was not true. I think the administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell did not believe the evidence when he spoke at the UN. I think this is a serious crime. The Bush administration does not care about the constitution. I think they want to continue the war to get more oil. I think it has gone on too long. But if we stop now, Iraq could have a civil war. The UN and the US want other countries to help. But this might cause more problems. The Iraqi government is not working well. The Prime Minister does not control the political process. Radical groups are fighting for power. I do not know what to say nicely about this.

I talk about the War in Iraq.
I talk about it because I feel it is not fair.
I feel like it is just a way to get back at Iraq. Many think Iraq did the attacks on the U.S. on 9/11.
I do not like the War on Iraq. I do not know many details about it.
We want to help Iraq become like the U.S. We also want to get oil from there.
But it is not a good reason to stay. It makes many people angry.
If we stay, we must try to build democracy there. This will take a long time.
If we leave, Iraq will be angry with us. We will leave them to start over.
I think the war should continue. I do not think it is a real war. Congress did not declare it.
I think it is like the Vietnam War. It was not declared and now it is called meaningless.
I feel bad for Bush. It makes him look bad.
I feel bad for the soldiers' families. Their sons and daughters are in Iraq. I want them to be safe.
But I also feel bad for the people in Iraq. We are trying to change their culture. This will make things worse.
I think the whole thing will go on for many years.
That is what I think about the War in Iraq.

I do not think it is right to make it legal or for a state to declare it as legal.
I believe it is up to churches to decide this.
The constitution says separation of church and state.
This means the government should not decide what churches can do.
People who want to make it illegal are choosing one church's beliefs over others.
The government should not decide what is legal or illegal for churches.
The government should not make an amendment about this.
Making this amendment would be wrong.
It would restrict people, not the government.
The government should not be involved in this issue.
The president is pushing for this amendment because he is Catholic.
Other religions should not be chosen over his.
Churches should decide this, not the president or government.
There is no good reason for an amendment to make it illegal.
This might help the economy and society.

The war in Iraq started in 2003. I did not think the government was completely honest about the reasons for war. The government said it was because of the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001. But this was not true. The war and the terrorist attacks were not connected. The government made people feel angry and wanted to go to war because of the attacks. I do not like war, especially when it is a preemptive strike. The war was like the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died. The government removed Iraq's government and did not plan for what would happen after. Iraq is still not peaceful. The American government should have learned from past mistakes. I think the war was not a good idea. If the government could not plan for the future, they should not have gone to war. Many American soldiers are still dying. The government said it would be a short and successful war. But it is a long and hard process to create a new government. Democracy in our own country took a long time. The government made it seem easy. I was thinking about voting in the 2004 election. I thought about voting for George Bush because he started the war. But it was hard to abandon Iraq after being there for so long. The United States took away Iraq's government and way of life. We cannot abandon them now. But there is also the issue of American soldiers' lives and how many is too many to lose. The main reason for invading Iraq was oil. The United States uses oil from Iraq. The government said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but they were not found. Other countries with weapons of mass destruction were not attacked. The government should be more truthful and careful in making decisions. I hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq. But probably not.

I am for gay marriage. I always have been. It is a personal choice. Some people think it is not, but I believe it is. I think it is not fair to take away rights because of something people cannot control. It is not right.

I think politics and government should not decide about marriage. It is a personal thing, not a political thing.

In my neighborhood, there are many gay couples. They live like other families. They walk their dogs and live happy lives. They should have the same rights as others.

I do not think the government should decide how people live their lives. They should not decide about marriage.

Some people think being gay is because of how you grow up. I do not think this is true. I think it is because of how your brain works.

Marriage should be a personal choice. If two people love each other, they should be able to marry. They should not have to tell anyone or make it public.

I do not think people should marry just to see their names in the news. It should be a private thing.

When you put something on the internet, it is public. Everyone can see it.
As a Resident Advisor, I have faced this issue before.
You put something online, people will see it and form opinions about you.
If you talk about bad things like blowing things up or shootings, people might think you are serious.
The internet is seen by many people. If you are friends with someone on Facebook, you get their updates.
When something serious happens, the school must take it seriously.
Teachers should not friend their students on Facebook or other social media.
If a student posts something dangerous, the school must take it seriously.
If a teacher or student finds something dangerous, they must report it.
The school does not invade privacy if they check social media to check for danger.
However, teachers should not make fake accounts to check students.
If a student posts something dangerous, the school must act.
The school should not monitor private messages like texts or IMs.
Teachers should not be friends with students on social media.
The school should only check social media to find dangerous posts.

The war has lasted too long. The goal was to help another country have a fair political system. This was good. But now, it seems like we are fighting for the sake of being a powerful country. The original reason was also mixed in with personal matters. The first few months showed our purpose. But the war has been going on for too long. We should stop. The government in that country needs to stand alone. We have our own problems, like poverty and schools. We should fix those problems. The money we have is not enough. We need to stop the war. It's been going on too long.

Can I ask a question to understand better? Why information on the internet can be a problem? If you post information on the internet, it's almost like giving it to everyone. Even on Myspace, people can see your profile if you accept them as friends. So, if that helps prevent a bad situation, is it good or bad? I think it's tough to decide. If one person looks at every student's profile all day, it seems like discrimination. But if they find something important, it might be good. I use Facebook, and I know people can see too much. I saw a TV show where someone got a girl's screen name and talked to her quickly. I don't know if that's good or bad. It's a tricky issue. I only accept people I know, but sometimes people still know too much about me. It's hard to decide how to use the internet. My roommate's high school banned Myspace. I don't think officials had the right to tell students they couldn't have it.

I have two reasons to talk about the Iraq War.
First, I feel bad talking about it.
I do not want to sound like everyone else who says "I was against it from the beginning."
I was against it, but it is not important now.
People everywhere think it was a bad idea.
Seventy-five to eighty percent of the world's people think it was a bad idea.
Eighty percent of Iraqis think it was a bad idea.
Seventy percent of U.S. troops think it was a bad idea.
The situation there is a disaster.
It was a disaster before we went in.
Pulling out will also be a disaster.
There is no easy way to handle the Middle East.
It is a big gap between the U.S. and Middle Eastern countries.
The U.S. thinks it can bring democracy to an area where it is not wanted.
Saddam was a bad leader, but we should consider the pros and cons before invading.
I do not know what to say about the Iraq War.
I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq.
I have not heard a good reason to stay.
I read that eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave.
I think they know what is best for them.
If they ask us to leave and we do, we will be good guys.
Even then, we will not be good guys in the Middle East.
Leaving will be better than where we are now.

I think gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. Women face many challenges in their jobs. For example, sometimes they cannot get promoted because people think women should not be in charge. Men also face problems. For example, if a man stays at home to take care of children, people might look down on him. In the fashion industry, men might not be taken seriously because society thinks only women understand fashion. I think society has changed a lot, but it takes time to change. We should continue to work slowly to help people understand that everyone can be successful, no matter their gender.

In Denver, they decriminalized marijuana. This means they made it not a crime. Before, it was a criminal offense. Now, if someone is caught, they get a ticket. This is different from being arrested and taken to jail. People worry about job interviews and other things, but this is better than having a drug charge. Decriminalization saves money for the city. The city can spend the money on education and social programs. Not everyone likes marijuana. It's important to think about how it affects people's lives. Alcohol and marijuana both have bad effects. People react differently to substances. It's hard to say what the effects will be.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are traditional.
This is good.
But also important to change.
Many Catholics must go to church each week.
They are strict.
Sometimes they do not accept others.
My parents could not marry in Catholic church.
My mom was Catholic, dad was Episcopalian.
They say to love others.
But they do not accept others.
This is not good.
I feel Catholic teachings are outdated.
They do not change.
I think priests should marry.

I am not sure if I agree or disagree.
I think this topic is difficult to discuss.
I think it is hard to talk about without hurting someone's feelings.
I think the government should treat all unions the same.
I think there should not be a special definition for marriage.
I think that is like saying that a government should look at a person's religion.
I think when people get married, it is like a civil union.
I think it is just two people who are together.
I think that gay marriage should just be a civil union too.
I think if all the states agree, then it should be a federal law.
I think a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage is not good.
I think the constitution should not be changed for this reason.
I think it is not important enough to change the constitution.
I think the government should not look at the type of marriage.
I think people should just be together.
I think it is like a civil union.
I think it is just two people.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is not easy for me to accept. I have many gay friends. I think they should be able to marry if they want. I do not think this should be a national problem. It should be decided by each state. I think states with many democrats will want gay marriage. If you live there, you should not argue with that. Homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. The president should not decide for everyone. I do not agree with Bush's ban on it. States should decide. The president should not control all states. He does not live in every state. Some things should be decided by each state. Bush will leave office soon. If a democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back and forth. The decision should be up to each state. They will live with the decision, not the president. I do not agree with Bush's ban.

Myspace is a public space. People can see what others post. School officials should not look for students doing bad things, but they should look if they have information about school safety. If they find something that makes the school safer, then it's good. However, if they just look to catch students, it's bad. They should not look just for bad things. They should look for things that might cause trouble. They should also check for signs of bad things that might happen, like school shootings. School officials should make the school safe. They should do this by looking for signs of trouble and preventing it. They should also make sure students are safe by practicing safety drills. All this is to make sure students are safe. That's what school officials should do.

I first thought war was good because of 9/11. I wanted to do harm, like they did to us. But I now think it was a mistake. I think we did not plan well. We went in without a plan. I think it has not helped. People over there fight each other. They cannot fight with us. I think we should not be there. I think they do not want to improve their country. They just want us to leave. I think we went there for revenge. I think President Bush wanted to go. People wanted it. I think we could not let Iraq attack us and rebuild. But we should have planned better. We did not know what to do. We did not have unity. I think we cannot change those people. I think they will always fight. We are not helping by staying there. It is like hurting ourselves.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things.
People are leaving because it does not accept many ideas.
Like, it does not accept gay marriage, abortion, or birth control.
The Church has strong views, but these are old-fashioned.
If it changes, it will not lose followers.
Some people are angry because of these views.
They do not agree with the Church.
If the Church changes, it will stop losing people.
It is against abortion.
People against abortion do not want to follow.
It is also against gay marriage.
People who like gay marriage do not follow.
The Church should let priests be married.
This might stop people leaving.
But, maybe it would not have helped.
Some changes did not stop things.
People do not know if priests marrying would help.
The Church says priests are married to God.
But, other people have families and jobs.
So, priests should also have families.

I'm okay with gay marriage. I think people are born this way. It's not a choice. I don't think gay people should be blamed for their sexual orientation. I think it's wrong to say a man and woman can marry, but two people of the same sex can't. It's not a conscious choice. I don't think the federal government should be involved. It's not a security or moral issue. I don't think they should punish gay people for being born this way.

I believe that same-sex marriage should be legal. Most people think that gay couples harm straight families, but they are different. Same-sex couples have the same relationship issues as straight couples. They need the same legal rights, like marriage certificates. This is not about religion. It is about legal documents. Gay couples want the same things as straight couples. They want to visit their partners in the hospital. They want to adopt children. Children of gay parents should be treated like other children. The federal government should allow same-sex marriage in every state. President Bush thinks it is wrong because of his religion. His beliefs about it are like his views on abortion and stem cell research. Most reasons for not allowing it are religious. This is not fair because the government should not enforce religious beliefs. Many people think that gay people are damaged. This is not true. The American Psychological Association says it is not true. People should listen to institutions that do research, not just other people.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal, but they can be good for people. We use drugs like oxycodone and Vicodin in the pharmacy. They are controlled substances, but we use them because they help people. People should not ignore the good parts of these drugs just because they are illegal. Marijuana is also a drug. If we remove the bad image of it, people might use it responsibly. Then, we can think about making it legal.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I always went to church every Sunday. I wore cute dresses, matching shoes, and a purse. I went to a private school and saw my friends there. Now, the church has a teenagers' mass that is only thirty minutes. People wear casual clothes, even during summer. Families often come late. In the morning, people wear jeans and khakis. I don't know the politics of the church, but that's the biggest change I noticed. About the accusations against Catholic priests, I don't think they could have been prevented by allowing female priests or married priests. Men who are married can still become pedophiles. They choose to become priests. Other religions allow priests to marry, but if they want to practice their faith and be married, they should consider a different faith. I think pedophilia is mostly genetic and cannot be hidden by marriage. The church could not have stopped this if they knew and covered it up, but I don't think they always knew.

I thought the war in Iraq was not good. Many people were upset after the September 11th attacks. The Bush administration said Saddam Hussein had weapons of mass destruction and this was not true. Colin Powell even said he did not believe the evidence he used in his UN speech. This is bad. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution and wanted to go to war.

I think the war is too long. If we stop now, Iraq may have a civil war and more people will die. The United Nations and the United States want to have a coalition of nations help. This may not be good because Iraq's sovereignty will be a problem. The Iraqi government is not working well. Many people are fighting for control. This is not a good way to rebuild the country.

I feel
I don't know much about the war in Iraq
We didn't declare war on Iraq
I don't think it's fair
I don't think it should be a war
I think we should help Iraq
But we're wasting resources
It's making President Bush look bad
I feel bad for the soldiers
But I don't want to change Iraq
It's not our culture

I don’t think it's right for a state to legalize or declare it legal. It's up to churches because the constitution says separation of church and state. This is clear. Trying to control it is against the constitution.

Most Catholics and Christians don’t support it. Only some areas like Boston do. This isn't up to the government. The government should not decide what churches can or cannot make illegal.

The constitution has a key part for religious tolerance. An amendment about this issue would not be right. It would restrict people, not the government. The only reason for an amendment is personal views, not the economy.

I don’t think the federal government should be involved. The president is pushing for it because of his Catholic beliefs. This shows a preference for one religion over others. It should be up to the churches to decide.

The war in Iraq
The government was not honest with American people about reasons for war
Government linked invasion to 9/11 attacks, but they were not connected
Government used emotions of people to start war in 2003
I was against war, especially preemptive strike
Iraq war like Vietnam war
Many American soldiers died, government not prepared for aftermath
Government removed Iraq's government, tried to create democratic government
Iraq had many insurgents, hard to control
I think government should have planned for all possible outcomes
Government was not ready for what happened after removing Iraq's government
Many American troops still in Iraq in 2006
Government made people think war would be short and successful
Democracy takes time and struggle, not easy
Government did not prepare for long struggle
War difficult decision in 2004 election
Wanted Bush to finish what he started, but many American soldiers died
War had many casualties, how much is too much risk?
Why not make other countries democratic, like Iraq?
War is often about oil and money
No weapons of mass destruction found in Iraq, but North Korea has them
Government not thorough or truthful in decisions
I hope war ends soon, brings peace, but probably not

I support gay marriage. I have always believed it.
This is a personal choice. It can be biological, not sociological. People should not lose rights they cannot control.

I think it's unfair. I am an advocate for gay marriage.

Politics and government should not decide. It's a personal matter, not a state-level issue.

In my neighborhood, there are gay couples. They live and behave like normal families. Bush's interpretation of marriage is not right.

I've seen and heard many reports. It can be a biological issue, not just social.

Marriage should be private, not public. It's not fair to make it public when two gay people want to marry.

No, I don't think so.

Putting things online is like putting them in a public place.
Everyone can see it.
As an RA, I had to deal with this before.
When you put something online, people might think bad things about you.
They can misunderstand what you mean.
Or they might not take it seriously when it is serious.
Like in our school, someone heard someone say something bad.
Then they told the school about it.
The school looked at the person's Facebook.
They found some things that might have been jokes.
But in this case, it became very serious.
You cannot stop people from seeing what you put online.
If you don't want something seen, don't put it online.
I don't think school officials should look at students' online accounts without reasons.
But if they find something dangerous, they must take it seriously.
They should not look at messages or texts without reasons.
Teachers should not make online accounts to spy on students.
If they find something dangerous, they must take it seriously.
I don't want to know what students do online.
I don't want to see their online pictures.
It is not my place to judge them.

I think the war has gone on too long. The original purpose was to restore democracy in another country. But now, I think we are just fighting to show that we are a powerful country. The original idea seemed fair. It was to help a country with a bad political system. But, I think there were also personal reasons because of George Bush's father's past disputes with Saddam Hussein. I think the war has become a bad thing. We did not need to fight for so long. We started the war to make a strong statement, but it has gone on for many years. I think the purpose has changed. It seems like we are just fighting for the sake of fighting. We do not want to leave without a clear victory. The war has gone on too long. It should stop. The country's government should handle its problems. We have our own problems here, like poverty. We should spend money on those instead of a long war. The country is spending too much money. We should spend it on our own problems. We have other important things to fix, like roads and schools. We should not spend money on a war that has lost its purpose. It is not good for our economy. We should use the money to help our own people.

I think it is important to understand that when you put your information online, many people can see it. For example, on sites like Myspace, only friends can see your profile, but once you accept them as friends, you give them permission to look at it. So, if someone finds your profile and prevents a problem, it might be a good thing. But it is not good if someone looks at profiles just to find trouble. It is also hard to decide what is right because we do not know why someone is looking at a profile. I do not have Myspace, but I have Facebook. Sometimes, I worry about people who see too much about me. I have met people in class who I do not recognize but they know about me from my profile. I only accept people I know, but I still do not know who can see my information. In high school, I heard that students were not allowed to have Myspace. I thought this was strange because I did not think the school had the right to say that. Privacy is important, and I do not know how schools have the right to control it.

I think about the Iraq War. I feel bad talking about it. I was against it from the start. But now, it's not so important. Many people think it was a bad idea. Most Iraqis and about 75% of U.S. troops think it's a bad idea. I think it was a mistake to go in. It's not easy to fix. The culture is different. We can't bring democracy there. Saddam was bad, but we should have weighed the pros and cons before going in. It's like quicksand. Now, I don't see a reason to stay. I don't hear a good reason to stay longer. If we leave now, we can help later. Iraqis want us to leave. They might know better. If we leave, we can still help if they need it. We might not be good guys there, but it's better than now. I don't think we should stay.

I feel that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. Not just for women, but in every work field.

In some fields, women may have trouble getting jobs because of a "glass ceiling." Even if they have the right skills, people often think women cannot lead in business. Similarly, men who stay home with children face society's judgment. Society expects men to work and be the main provider.

In fashion, people often don't take men seriously because they think fashion is only for women. They may wonder if a man can understand women's fashion well.

In all fields, I think change is slow because society has set mindsets. But things are improving. More women become CEOs and people accept this change over time. The same is true for stay-at-home dads. People now see that it's okay for men to raise children.

To change things, we must work slowly and promote good qualities of people, not force change. We must not do too much too fast as people resist too quickly.

Sometimes, people judge others based on the job they have or where they come from. For example, someone from a farm might not have great grammar but be very intelligent. This might cause others to doubt their intelligence.

There's also discrimination between genders, like men looking down on women or vice versa.

They did not legalize it. They made it less serious. It changed from a crime to a minor offense. Like getting a traffic ticket. Arrest and jail are no longer needed. It saves money. But some people still worry about the future. Decriminalization does not change that. Some places do not decriminalize because they do not want to spend money. Denver decriminalized it. Now they spend money on education and social programs. Marijuana should not be everywhere. It is taboo in many places. Legalizing it might be awkward. Alcohol has more effect on driving. But both have bad effects. People react differently. Some react badly, others not.

I say yes. Some things they do are very traditional. They do the same things for a long time. It is good to be rooted in tradition. But it is also important to be adaptable to change. Many Catholics go to Church every week. They are strict about how things are done. They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They do not accept people of other religions. My parents were an Episcopalian and a Catholic. They would not marry them in the Catholic Church because of my dad's religion. It is not tolerant of other religions. We learn to love others. But it is hypocritical to say to love others and then not accept them. Sometimes, the Catholic practice goes against the doctrine. It is outdated. They continue to stick with it. I think it would be good to allow priests to marry. But I do not think it would prevent pedophilic behavior. People who molest children probably would do that regardless of whether they have a spouse or not. It is a child, not a spouse. I think allowing priests to marry would not prevent those things from happening.

I don't know yet. I think both sides have strong arguments. This issue is very difficult because it involves the separation of church and state, and how to define marriage. I think that if the government views all marriages as civil unions, it would be fair. That way, no one would be offended. I don't think that the constitution should be changed just to ban gay marriage. That's not important enough. It's better to leave the decision to the states.

I was raised in a Christian home. Homosexuality is not clear to me. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with their lifestyle, but I think it should be legal. I do not think it should be a national problem. Each state should decide, not the president.

Many states are Democratic and Republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know its stance. I think you should not disagree with the state's decision. Each state has the right to make this choice because those who live there will be affected.

I do not think President Bush should decide for the whole country. He does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state runs. He will be out of office in two years. If a Democratic president lifts the ban, it will change back and forth. It should be up to each state to make the decision because they will live with it.

I do not agree with Bush's ban on gay marriage.

I do not agree. When students post on Myspace, they expect others to see their messages. School officials should have the right to check these posts. They might find students doing bad things and help make the school safer. For example, they can stop a school shooting. If they go on the internet just to catch students, it is an invasion of privacy. They should only check if it helps the school. I discussed this with a teacher. They said they practice safety drills because of the terrorist attacks. The school shooting is like this. The officials just want to make the school safer. That's all.

In 2001, I supported the war in Iraq because of the 9/11 attacks. However, I now feel differently.
We acted too quickly and without a plan. The war did not achieve what we wanted.
The people in Iraq have fought each other for a long time. I do not think they can stop fighting even if we try to help them.
We did not know what to expect in Iraq. We made mistakes. We did not think about the long-term effects.
I do not think we can change them. They will continue to fight even after we leave.
We should leave Iraq and focus on our own country.
